27001.name: X Factor
27001.description:
Magnetic based board game from the makers of Magz magnetic construction sets.

Each player has a set of Magnetic X tiles. Each tile has different symbols on its sides (hearts, spades, clubs and diamonds). The timer is started and players race to add tiles to the board, making sure the symbols match. Tiles can be added either 2 dimension or in 3D.

27003.name: Scar-Nee and IQ Solitaire
27003.description: Abstract Strategy game for 1 to 4 players. Similar to Teeko but played on a 4x4 board and using 16 discs(4 different colors each numbered with pips 1 through 4)

27004.description: Chess variant for 2 players (using a bigger board), 3 players (2 vs. 1) or 4 players (teams or individual)
27004.name: Quadroschach

27005.name: Just Say No! Game
27005.description:
The object is to be the first player to unlock the Just Say No! Castle with a golden key. Players earn keys by answering a question on a card. There are no right or wrong answers. For example, "How would you say No if someone tried to give you a pill? Or "What does crack look like?"
Game was endorsed by the National Just Say No! Foundation, a Nancy Reagan thing.

27006.description: The goal of this game is to build a pyramid of monkeys. There are three types of monkeys and all three types come in three colors. Per turn you can only build your pyramid in one color. When building the other players only see the back of each monkey, so they don't know the constitution of other players' pyramids. The only way to find out is to attack! And attacking is also necessary to keep other players from finishing their pyramids. Finishing your pyramid is a true feat of bananalympics.
27006.name: WooHiiWooHaha

27007.description:
ATO (2012) edition description

Though the roots went back decades before, maybe you could say it “started” with a special train, guarded from Switzerland to a Swedish ferry… as part of the German war effort…to “plant” an exiled Vladimir Lenin back into Russian soil, fertile for revolution. The Germans hoped to take Russia out of the war, but they never dreamed how much the world would change.

Now, Against the Odds lets you explore the tangled facets of the Russian Civil War, with the historical situation exemplified by a game that handles two to four players…with up to three of them commanding the “White” Russian factions! (In multi-player games, if the Reds are defeated, the game isn’t over yet!) For Bloody Honor: Civil War Russkaya captures the interactions of political influence, railways, foreign intervention, and the discord among the White factions that gave the Bolsheviks their best chance to win in a battle against — as it seemed to them — their internal enemies and the whole Western Alliance. (Yes, there were British, French, Canadian, Australian, Indian, Japanese, and even U.S. troops fighting in Russia as late as 1920…and even later for the Japanese).

For Bloody Honor includes 10 game turns, each representing 4 months of real time from the end of 1918 to the end of 1921, and driven by chit pull which will guarantee no two turns are alike. Units represent organized troops of various sizes, with each counter (except tanks) of relatively equal strength. Yes, depending on the situations, this can become a “buckets of dice” game…or the fate of a region (and the political points that go with it) may hinge on a single unit. Defeat can be costly, not only in lost units but in the potential for defecting as your units may decide the other side has more to offer them!

Can you, as the Reds, repeat history and form a Union of Soviet Socialists Republics? Or can you, as the Whites, change the course of events in the 20th century?” The only way to find out is by playing to “Pobeda” (victory).

Bonus Game Inside! Also included in this issue is a second, bonus game, Operation Cerberus by designer Paul Rohrbaugh. This small Pocket Battle Game depicts the famous event of Feb. 1942 where heavy surface units of the German Navy dashed up the English Channel to reach home waters - right under the noses of the Royal Navy and Air Force!

Map - One full color 22"x34" mapsheet
Counters - 240 full color 1/2" die-cut pieces
Rules length - 12 pages
Charts and tables - 2 pages
Complexity - Medium
Solitaire suitability - Average

Design - Mark Woloshen
Development - Lembit Tohver
Graphics - Mark Mahaffey

Against the Odds Magazine #37.


Firefight (2006) edition description

Mark Woloshen's epic game covering the Russian Civil War has been teaching history students the nuances of this complicated period. Now, Firefight Games offers it as a wargame. The game is unique for the rules cover everything in simplicity yet, making the correct decision makes it tough to master! Political influence and recruiting plays a vital and realistic role, for these decisions will impact military units and their use! Technology (tanks, aircraft) is important but it alone cannot win the game. The beautiful area map conveys at a glance the massive expanses of the war, for each area plays a critical political role. The game is deceptively simple to learn, yet, like Chess, hard to master. A grand strategic game on the Russian Civil War from 1918 to 1922, with each turn being four months, units represent 5 - 15,000 men, while tanks, aircraft, armor cars and armor trains are abstracted amounts. One player plays the Red , the other plays the White Factions (Polish, Kolchak, Denikin etc). The map is divided into zones. The game, designed by Mark Woloshen, designed a game that is used frequently by his students to learn about the complexities of the RCW. Thus, it is focused on how the political influence and control impacted the military events. One cannot win by military means alone. The game relies on activations and recruiting new men to man the armies is of major importance subject the game's political realities! Unlike other strategic RCW games, this plays in a few hours' time.
27007.name: For Bloody Honor: The Russian Civil War

27008.name: The International Pro-Am Sailboard Game
27008.description: Designed and published by the sailboarding community in 1988, Pro-Am pits players (sailboarders) against each other as they race around the board collecting sponsorships, forging a career, and testing their knowledge on sailboarding. The game can be played on three different levels, from the experienced sail boarder down to the first timers and non-sailboarders who play on the 'Learner' level. Nicely outfitted with plenty of sponsorship options, career directions, and 'sailboards' pieces, the game delves deep into the world of sailboard racing.

27009.name: Today with Dave Garroway
27009.description:
Simple spin-and-move game distinguished only by presentation. The pawns are lead figures designed to resemble television cameras. The backdrop to the gameboard has pop-up figures giving the gameboard a 3-D effect. The game comes with a xylophone that must be played or the participant who misses the cue is penalized. The first to reach the finish space is the winner.

An unusual place on the GameBoard is the Station Break Area which is represented by clock symbols. If you land on or pass over one of these Station Breaks you must ring the TIME SIGNAL TONES to properly identify the network. If you fail to do so you must move your camera back 15 spaces.

27010.name: Jan Murray's Treasure Hunt
27010.description:
Each player will act as quizmaster for another player so everyone can compete. A random category for each round is determined by the Bid Wheel. Every correct answer earns the player fifty dollars. A round consists of four questions for each player. The winner of round chooses a card which represents a treasure chest and its treasure. The player also spins the Bid Wheel. The player may now choose between the known amount on the Bid Wheel (range: $250 to $2000) or take whatever happens to be on the card (range: $0 to $25,000)

The player who chooses and keeps the $25,000 treasure chest card is the immediate winner. Otherwise, the game goes the full four rounds. The winner is the person who has the most money after four rounds of play.

The game is based on a popular television series of the fifties.

27011.name: Dave Garroway's Today Game
27011.description:
The players take on the role of television show producer vying to book the best guests for television’s “The Today Show”. The deck is divided into four suits. Each suit represents a category of guest. Each suit has cards valued one through twelve; one being the greatest value and twelve having the least value. There are also four wild cards, valued at thirteen, to bring the total number of cards in the deck to fifty-two.

All players place their pawns on the start space. Each player chooses a card secretly. All players reveal their chosen cards simultaneously. The player who played the highest valued card gets to advance one’s own pawn the number of spaces equal to value of the winning card. The rules are do not state what happens if two or more players tie. If two or more players play wild cards, there is no winner and the hand is replayed.

Certain spaces on the track assign a player who happens to land on them a personal trump suit. This trump stays in effect until the player moves on.

The hand is over when someone lands on the “Off the Air” space at the end of the track. The value of the cards remaining in the hand of the players is totaled and added to the score of the player who ended the round. All players receive the value of the cards in tricks each has taken. The first player to score five hundred points is the winner.

27012.name: Future Tank
27012.description:
From the back of the rule book:

FUTURE TANK

Future tank is a two-player board game pitting players against each other with tank armies of their own choosing!

Players have four different types of tanks to choose from in which to build their armies:

1) Fast-Assault Tanks: Quick, highly maneuverable and able to outflank any other tank with cutting precision.

2) Light-Assault Tanks: Fast, but more heavily armored and more heavily weaponed. It can pack a solid punch.

3) Heavy-Assault Tanks: Slow, but carry the biggest gun!

4) Missile Tanks: Slow and heavily armored. Able to kill from a distance.

Rules are easy-to-read and play-action can let you start blasting away in the first turn! Terrain features are optional and six scenarios are included.

Average Play Time: 20-40 Minutes."

Played on a chess board, this games uses either the photocopied "counters" from the book, or minis of your choosing. You will also need a D4, D6, D8 and D12. A basic move and attack format. Lighter moves further and heaver shoots further. Each tank has a diagram showing its armor amounts (think SFB shields) and has ratings for movement, firing ranges and weapon damage.

27013.name: UnStack
27013.description: UnStack was created by Professor João Pedro Neto, Lisbon (Portugal), in 2001. It is a stacking game in which counters are distributed in a way that resembles the "sowing" in Mancala games.

27014.name: The $64,000 Question
27014.description:
THE $64,000 QUESTION is a board game based on the UK version of the TV Game Show. The aim of the game is to work along a question path answering questions and enter 'the isolator' to answer the $64,000 question. The first player to get the $64,000 question correct is the winner.

Questions are categorized into 10 subject areas which are selected by the roll of a 10 sided die. An additional category is provided when playing with younger players.

27015.name: Poetic Justice
27015.description:
From the box:

"POETIC JUSTICE" is the super-duper, pretty-witty game where one word leads to another. All you need is a dash of logic and a flash of inspiration to uncover the poetic solutions.

Poetic Cards consist of cleverly worked clues which are solved with rhyming couplets and a splash of humor!

Depending on where you land on the board you may have to play solo, challenge another player or join everyone else in this game of reason and rhyme."

27016.name: Noel's House Party
27016.description:
NOEL'S HOUSE PARTY is a board game spin-off from the UK's TV Show of the same name. It involves recreations of the main features of the show.

From the box:

"Round and around Crinkley Bottom you go... in for the Music Game .... down the cellar for 'Wait till I get you home'. But who's that at the door? - better go and find out, oh no! you've landed in the grunge tank - or worse still you've to face the NTV talent test.

This new and exiting family game is fast-paced and action packed and features a fully working three-dimensional 'Grad a Grand' booth complete with miniature money".

The aim of the game is to collect the most money by moving around the board and performing a variety of actions based on the draw of a card:

NTV - act out the instructions on the card.
KNOCK KNOCK - Guess the identity of someone from clues on the card.
WAIT TILL I GET YOU HOME! - Guessing what answer another player will give to a question.
MUSIC GAME - Music based trivia or performance card.

Other spaces require you to spin again, miss a turn or take possion of the Gotcha! (allowing you to score double points whilst you have it).

27017.name: Risks and Rhymes
27017.description:
Purple Ronnie's Groovy Game of RISKS AND RHYMES is an adult game involving moving around a board, making up poems, acting and drinking (preferably alcoholic beverages)

There are two decks of cards:
the first represents different character types (i.e.slob, sex goddess, mummy's boy ...)
the second comprises risks and rhymes. Risk cards involve acting out whatever is written on the card. The rhyme cards contain a short poem to which the final line needs to be added.

Players move round the board as per the roll of a die. The space they land on determines what action they need to perform:
- Borrow a character card from another player
- Miss a turn
- take a Risk and Rhymes card for themselves or another player
- Roll again
- Give a character card to another player

All risks and rhymes must be performed in the style of the character card in play at the time with a successful performance resulting in winning of that character card. The winner is the player who, at the end of the game, has collected the most character cards.

27018.name: Your First Impression
27018.description:
The players must deduce which of the six given historical figures is the correct one. The players choose and ask the questions on the cards given to them while the quizmaster responds according to the answer key. The player who gives the correct answer scores points depending on how many questions were asked by the players. The first to score one hundred points is the winner.

The game is loosely based on a television series designed by Monty Hall of Let’s Make a Deal fame. Mr. Hall’s name is misspelled on the box lid.

27019.name: Diamino Chinois
27019.description:
Word game similar to Diamino, by the same publisher, except that it uses hexagonal tiles instead of square ones. Unlike Diamino, tiles do not have point values
Like Diamino, it has some tiles with a red logo or design on it.

27020.name: Circulus
27020.description:
Four "snakes" consisting of 12 tokens each try to conquer numbered spaces on the game board. A dice rolling game for up to four players.
Roll the dice and move your snake by placing same number of pieces as rolled from the end of your snake in front of it. Try to surround a circle with your snake and score by placing a snake piece inside the surrounded circle. So your snake becomes shorter and you will have less pieces to surround the next circles.

27021.name: Diamantenfieber
27021.description: A fishing game with semi-precious stones. Players hide magnetic stones in 12 heaps of non-magnetic stones, then try to fish out as many magnetic stones from all heaps as they can.

27022.name: Tank battles in miniature 1
27022.description:
subtitle - A wargamers' guide to the Western Desert Campaign 1940-1942

Book including miniatures rules for wargames in the North African desert during WW2.

From the publisher's description;

...contents include a summary of the actual campaign, illustrated with numerous maps, plus technical specifications for the vehicles, tanks, guns and aircraft used. Further chapters cover terrain, communications, visibility, navigation, firing tank and anti-tank guns, 'brewing up', air operations, the Long Range Desert Group, minefields and supply. There are also appendices on British and Axis armored formations, recognition silhouettes, armor penetration tables and the construction of various wargaming aids.

27023.name: Discovering Wargames
27023.description:
Small paperback book serving as an introduction to miniatures wargaming and also containing rules for use from the ancient period up to the American Civil War (1 rule set for the whole lot !)

Rules are based on rolling a one die for each group of six figures when shooting, or counting heads and multiplying by a die roll in melee. Also includes rules for differing formations and for morale.

27024.description:
Savage Worlds Weird Wars: Vietnam setting covering both the French and American wars.

From the Pinnacle website:

Welcome to the jungle, baby! Now you're gonna die!

If it bleeds …you can kill it. Or so they say.

But who really knows? Who knows what horrors lurk in the jungles of “the ‘Nam?” There are rumors, of course, but there are even more rumors of squads—even whole companies—just disappearing into the bush. But the brass says nothing. And the body bags just keep coming.

You know how bad the booby traps and ambushes are, but have you ever wondered what dark Gods those forgotten jungle temples were built for? Or what makes those bizarre crying sounds in the remote highlands, far away from any villages? Or why even the locals fear the so-called “cannibalistic” mountain tribes?

Lock and load your M-16, feed a belt into your M-60, and load another round in your Thumper, soldiers.

You’re going to war. Weird War.

Tour of Darkness is the Weird Wars: Vietnam game setting. It requires the Savage Worlds rules to play.

Tour of Darkness includes rules for Sanity, Terror, new Edges and Hindrances, and complete Plot Point Campaigns for both the American and French tours in Vietnam.

Expands:

Savage Worlds
27024.name: Tour of Darkness

27025.name: Joseph And His Coat Of Many Colors
27025.description:
Joseph And His Coat Of Many Colors is a variation on the popular game of UNO with uniquely illustrated cards depicting the biblical character of Joseph wearing his colored coats. Players are trying to empty their hands of cards by playing them to a common pile, matching cards by color, number, or action. The deck is made up of 4 sets of differently colored cards with numbers from 1 to 6. There are also Miracle cards (wild cards), cards that cause the next player to pick up 1 or 2 cards, and Skip cards.

Note: This game is different from UNO in the following ways:
- Instead of "Draw 4 wild cards", this game contains some "Draw 1" cards. This is in addition to the "Draw 2 cards" both games have.
- This game has only a 35-card deck.
- When a person has only one card left in their hand, they are to call out "Joseph".

27027.name: 18MY
27027.description:
An 18XX game series based on the railroad development in Malaya (Malaysia before Independence). It is set in 1885, when the first railroads were built to transport cargo between the Ports.

Special rules include:

a) The map includes part of Southern Siam (Thailand).
b) A Siam Pass is up for auction after the Private Companies Auction but before the Stock buying round (on the first turn). Siam Pass is then auctioned out again when the first '3' train and '5' train is bought. The holder of the Siam Pass allow one of his/her Corporation to run trains into Siam without rolling the 'Train Hijack' die. (See Below)
c) Train Hijack mechanics. Where, while running trains into Siam, the corporation president must roll a die. On the roll of 4,5 or 6, the train is hijacked and no revenues are generated from that train. The train card is then flipped over and cannot be used until after the next stock round.

27028.description:
Based on the Anima: Beyond Fantasy roleplaying game setting, Anima: Tactics is a skirmish-level miniatures combat game that pits heroic characters against each other in the struggle between Light and Dark. The system uses 10-sided dice as well as character statcards and asset cards that provide new abilities for the characters.

Each player brings a party of heroes to the field of battle, choosing characters, equipment, and other advantages with total levels no more than the fixed value selected for the game (250 levels for a standard game). No party may contain characters from both the Light and Darkness faction, unless all characters in the party are drawn from the same affiliation (there are eight affiliations in the game, such as the Church, the Empire, or the Black Sun trading cartel).

In the standard 250 LV game, each player will have 4 ~ 6 models. The winner is the player with the most levels of characters still on the battlefield at the end of ten turns.

There are two starter sets available right now - Light faction and Dark faction:
Each starter set includes
2 unpainted pewter figures (around 100 LV)
2 advantage cards
1 rulebook
1 ten-sided die
Several action counters and state counters.
27028.name: Anima Tactics
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise
Anima Tactics: Ahriman, Lord of Darkness
Anima Tactics: Black Sun Box Set
Anima Tactics: Elhaim, Maiden of Light
Anima Tactics: Samiel, The Black Lion
Anima Tactics: Valis Ul Del Vilfain

27029.name: High School Musical DVD Game
27029.description:
From bestbuy.com summary:

"High school is a stage and here's your chance to be a part of the show. Jump into the hit Disney Channel movie High School Musical with this fun, interactive DVD game. Enjoy video clips, original outtakes and all of the songs and dances you love from the movie.

Compete against your friends in four challenging categories: Outtakes, Song, Dance and Relationship. The first player to make his or her way around the school for the final call back audition is the winner. Prove you have what it takes to make it in high school. After all, it really is just a song and a dance. "

27030.name: Disaster!
27030.description:
DISASTER! is for ages 8 and up, 2 to 4 players with an average playing time 15 - 30 minutes.
Learn about natural disasters and how they affect the U.S, including how scientists rank the strengths of the different disasters. Learn which geographic areas are at risk and how the seasons affect a disaster's occurrence. Tornadoes, earthquakes, hurricanes, floods, wildfires... are just a few of the disasters that you'll face in this game. Game includes: Deck of 59 full color board Disaster & Defense playing cards, full-color game board featuring map of US, 15 color territory marker pieces.

Each card contains facts and information about specific historical disasters. In DISASTER!, you want to control territories of the US that are worth different points. You gain territories by playing disaster cards against your opponent's territories, like a hurricane against Florida. But your opponent might have a defense... like The National Hurricane Center... To block you. Each game last 16 turns, with each turn a different season. Many disasters can only be played during certain seasons. At end of the last turn , add up your points for the territories you control, the player with the highest points wins!

27031.name: Confucianism and the Succession Crisis of the Wanli Emperor, 1587
27031.description:
From Description:

Confucianism and the Succession Crisis of the Wanli Emperor, 1587 seeks to introduce undergraduate students to the suppleness and power of Confucian thought as applied to issues of governance during the Ming dynasty. The game is set in the Hanlin Academy. Most students are members of the Grand Secretariat of the Hanlin Academy, the body of top-ranking graduates of the civil service examination who serve as advisers to the Wanli emperor. Some Grand Secretaries are Confucian "purists,” who hold that tradition obliges the emperor to name his first-born son as successor; others, in support of the most senior of the Grand Secretaries, maintain that it is within the emperor’s right to choose his successor; and still others, as they decide this matter among many issues confronting the empire, continue to scrutinize the teachings of Confucianism for guidance. The game unfolds amidst the secrecy and intrigue within the walls of the Forbidden City, as scholars struggle to apply Confucian precepts to a dynasty in peril.

27032.name: Meatgrinder Battle of Xuan Loc April 1975
27032.description:
This is a redux to Perry Moore's original game. Defiance: The Battle of Xuan Loc (Swedish Games).

Covers the Battle of Xuan Loc April 1975. Basically ARVN defenders backed up by air power vs. hordes of NVA with tanks and heavy artillery. This was the last stand of the South Vietnamese Army against all odds (which is why it may become an ATO issue game). The ARVN 18th division armed with M-48 Tanks and Cluster bombs conduct themselves in a heroic manner, so much so, that it becomes noticed by the outside world media press. The battle involved large amounts of aircraft and tanks. The ARVN defiant stand stunned the three NVA Divisions assigned to take the town. The two sides clashed for 10 days-it became a battle of honor! This game is a much improved version of Perry's earlier 1982 game.

System is similar to Perry Moore's Nanawa: Verdun in the Chaco War, July 1933.

27033.description:
You go far beyond the oldest place, to serve the Dark Overlord. You faced the worst perils to put your hands on the magician's hat. Now the Genius of Evil has new quests for you, and you'll have to go even beyond, through dimensions, getting new treasures and facing new perils. Maybe even the Death herself.
But the real peril will be to face the Rigor Mortis, if you'll fail another time.

"Sì, Oscuro Signore! 2 - L'alba degli eroi" it's the first expansion for Aye, Dark Overlord! The Red Box also known as "Aye, Dark Overlord", and it'll bring you new cards with places to explore, people to meet and treasures to retrieve. And that's not all... You, the goblins, will have new actions to make even more difficult your fellow party to escape the right Wrath of the Dark Overlord.

Until now, it was only a joke.
27033.name: Sì, Oscuro Signore! 2: L'alba degli eroi
boardgameexpansion: Aye, Dark Overlord! The Red Box

27034.name: Wolf in Disguise
27034.description:
In Wolf in Disguise, players seek to wreck havoc at the peaceful ranch. Each player is a Shepherd who tries to gain the most profit on the ranch. Player can hire wolf to attack other player's sheep or raise shepherd dog to protect his own sheep. However, to make the game interesting, all the wolves are disguised as sheep.

Wolf in disguise is a game derived from the famous book, The Art of War - Thirty-Six Stratagems thought by some to be written by Sun Tzu. The idea came from the twentieth Stratagem in the book, "Fish in troubled water."

27035.name: Legends of the Ancient World: The Gates to the Underworld
27035.description:
From the publisher:

"Only the Necromancer can help you summon back the demons of the underworld that have risen to plague the land. But you must first seal the breaches through which the demons entered the world of the living before undertaking the journey to Hell itself. "

This is a paragraph-system game with a hex board and counters, inspired by Metagaming's Melee.

27036.name: Känner du Pippi Långstrump
27036.description:
Children´s trivia game about Pippi Longstocking and friends.

Each player receives eight tiles with pictures from the books. Players lay them on the table in front of them and memorize the order of the pictures. Then they turn their tiles face-down. Players are then ready to take turns rolling the die and moving on the board.

If they land on a red spot, the game master picks up a red card and reads a quote from a story. The text is associated with one of the pictures on the players´ tiles. The first player to turn up the right tile gets a freckle painted in her face - a make-up stick is included in the game! As you know, Pippi is proud of her freckles.

If they land on a yellow spot, they get one freckle.

If they land on a green spot, the player answers a question from a card. If correct, the player gets one gold coin.

The first player to land on one of the blue spots gets the coin that was placed their before game start. No new coins are added during the game.

The first player to reach the finish gets three coins. The winner is the player with most points (total of freckles and coins!).

Age 5 years and up. Children will need someone to read the cards.

27037.name: The Threshold of Democracy: Athens in 403 B.C.
27037.description:
The Threshold of Democracy: Athens in 403 B.C. is one of the first games in the Reacting to the Past game series originally created by Mark Carnes, history professor at Barnard College/Columbia University. These games are intended for undergraduate or graduate students led by an instructor (facilitator)

Participants are assigned roles with secret role sheets and secret victory objectives. The object of the game is to achieve the stated objective for each player.

The game is set in Athens soon after the tyrants installed by Sparta were overthrown. The game focuses upon the future of democracy in Athens. Participants are given a variety of roles: moderate democrats, radical democrats, oligarchs, Socratics and more.

Participants need read and refer to Plato's Republic (not included) and excerpts (included) from Thucydides, Xenophon, and other primary sources.

The game requires substantial reading, writing, and verbal debate.

Awards:
The Reacting to the Past series won the 2004 Hesburgh Award for innovative undergraduate education using gaming.

The American Historical Association awarded the 2006 William Gilbert Award to Mark C. Carnes for the best article on teaching history--focusing upon the Reacting to the Past games.

27039.name: Scene it? Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten
27039.description:
In this version of "Scene It? Movie?" you find scenes and questions about the German daily soap "Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten".] It is a stand alone DVD game about famous german TV show.

"How much do you know about Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten (as seen on TV)? Test your knowledge of the entire Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten gang with Scene It? The Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten Game Pack. Featuring clips, puzzlers and questions from all seasons! Scene It? The Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten Game Pack can add to any Scene It? game or play as a stand-alone title. For 2 or more adult players."

27040.description:
This Age of Steam Expansion expands the game to Mars.

Age of Steam Expansion - Mars: Global Surveyor is an expansion for the basic game Age of Steam. The originality of this expansion is that the green discs (the Martians) can move around the planet, birth with blue cubes. The map uses the same mechanic than Age of Steam on the Moon and allows edges connections.

This expansion is sold on the back of the reprint Age of Steam: The Moon, and printed on one large heavy plasticized paper map (52cm x 36cm)
boardgameversion: AoS Team Moon/Mars Edition, Second Printing
27040.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Mars – Global Surveyor

27041.description:
Each Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly, so this ain’t no game for the nerds/geeks of this world, even they might think so, because it’s full of surprises and pure fun. Highly recommended, because Anno Domini is a blast to play, is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Unfortunately there is no English edition in existence, but this game could be a good way, to improve your already existing German skills or a very good reason, to learn German language in the first place.

The set "Österreich" contains historical events which are related to Austria. This relationship is not necessary obvious. Like all Anno Domini the Austria edition can be played as standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

Part of the Anno Domini series
27041.name: Anno Domini: Österreich

27042.name: Veritas
27042.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Veritas is a Euro-style board game about the preservation of truth in Dark Ages France. Each player represents some "truth" that's trying to be preserved for posterity by diligent book-copying monks. Players place and copy book tokens in monasteries, then pick up stacks of books and spread them around France. Each turn, a monastery will burn down, and the books in it may be destroyed. After the monasteries have burned down, players can move through them, so travel on the board gets faster as the game progresses. When scoring chips are drawn, each player whose ideology dominates a region scores points. The first player to score 100 points wins, becoming the dominant truth as the Dark Ages end.

27043.description: This is a special Version for the 250th birthday of the Austrian lottery.
27043.name: Trivial Pursuit: 250 Jahre Österreichisches Zahlenlotto

27044.name: Vincent Time Path
27044.description:
Directly from the rules:

By offering cards for completion the players jointly create a path that takes them through various periods taken from the life of Vincent Van Gogh.
The first player to get rid of all his cards is the winner.

Contents of the box:

48 cards
4 brushes
4 holders
1 dice
rule book

27045.name: Rousseau, Burke, and Revolution in France, 1791
27045.description:
From Description:

Rousseau, Burke, and Revolution in France, 1791 plunges students into the intellectual, political, and ideological currents that surged through revolutionary Paris in the summer of 1791. Students are leaders of major factions within the National Assembly (and in the streets outside) as it struggles to create a constitution amidst internal chaos and threats of foreign invasion. Will the king retain power? Will the priests of the Catholic Church obey the “general will” of the National Assembly or the dictates of the pope in Rome? Do traditional institutions and values constitute restraints on freedom and individual dignity or are they its essential bulwarks?


Are slaves, women, and Jews entitled to the “rights of man”? Is violence a legitimate means of changing society or of purging it of dangerous enemies? In wrestling with these issues, students consult Jean-Jacques Rousseau’s Social Contract and Edmund Burke’s Reflections on the Revolution in France, among other texts.

27046.name: 1881: Das Berliner Strassenbahnspiel
27046.description: 1881 is an 18xx game about the tram companies of Berlin and the arrival in the city of the S-Bahn. It was designed by Michael Mette and published by him under license from Hartland Trefoil. It was later released in a free downloadable version.

27047.name: Town Hall
27047.description:
This is an early tile-placement game. The equipment consists of 80 hexagonal wooden tiles - 10 house tiles for each player, 1 town hall tile, and 39 road tiles of various configurations.

Players play a road tile of their choice each turn in an effort to create empty spaces with exactly three neighbors, in which they can place their houses. The object is place all of one's house tiles and then the town hall tile.

A slightly altered version was published (probably in the 1960s) by Whitman, with cardboard tiles.

boardgameimplementation: Duel in the Dark: Second Edition
boardgamecompilation: Duel in the Dark: Second Edition
boardgamehonor: 2007 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2007 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Wargame Nominee
27048.description:
From the publisher's website:

World War 2 air combat game depicting the nighttime air raids of British bombers hitting German cities.

As the head of the British Bomber Command, you plan the attacks on Germany in order to undermine the morale of the civilian population. Or as a General of the German Air Force (Luftwaffe), you defend using your ace squadrons and organizing an effective civil defense.

The gameboard enables you to set up countless variations of these historic events. You play as many nights as you wish - each night takes 30-45 minutes to resolve.

Immerse yourself in the strategic and tactical thinking needed to survive in those dark times.

Gameplay allows for easy entry into the action with some advanced rules for the hearty wargamer. The game rules include weather conditions, full moon/new moon bonuses and penalties, clouds and thunderclouds, fog, flak, searchlights, balloon barriers, target markers, and much more.

The British player secretly plots the course of the bomber while the Mosquito acts as escort or decoy. The German player tries to figure out where the bomber is going, making sure to efficiently use the fuel to get as many hits on the bomber as possible.
27048.name: Duel in the Dark
boardgameexpansion: Duel in the Dark: 3-5 Player Variant
Duel in the Dark: Acoustic Mirror
Duel in the Dark: Baby Blitz
Duel in the Dark: British 3.7in QF Anti-Aircraft Gun
Duel in the Dark: British Searchlight
Duel in the Dark: Early Nights
Duel in the Dark: Ju88 Night Fighter
Duel in the Dark: Quad Flak
Duel in the Dark: Railroad Flak
Duel in the Dark: Skilled Gun Crew
Duel in the Dark: Tactical Cards
Duel in the Dark: The Complete Edition – Expansion
Duel in the Dark: The Walls Have Ears
Duel in the Dark: Window / Wilde Sau
boardgamepodcastepisode: Three Moves Ahead 146: On the Air

27049.name: Homeschoolopoly
27049.description:
From the Website:
This brand new game from veteran homeschoolers Greg & Pamela Berthume combines all of the fun and educational qualities of the old-fashioned family favorite board game and celebrates the best of homeschooling. You start out at Home Sweet Homeschool and pass by squares like Public School Tax or Field Trip, and if you land on the right square you might get to purchase a Big Family Bus or a Cool As Can Be SUV! And of course, you'll want to try to avoid running into the Truancy Officer lying in wait to send a homeschooler to court! Don't worry, you can use your "HSLDA Member - GET OUT OF COURT FREE" card.

While playing you'll get to buy properties with your favorite homeschool companies and organizations like HSLDA, Rosetta Stone, Sonlight Curriculum, Greek 'n' Stuff, KONOS, Schoolhouse Store, WriteShop, Artes Latinae, Excellence in Writing, Geography Matters, CLASS, Christian Liberty Press, Centrifuge Language Arts, Systematic Mathematics, Cornerstone Curriculum, Rainbow Resources, Homeschooling Parent Magazine, Teach Magazine, World Magazine, God's World News, The Young Scientist Club, Learning Adventures, HomeschoolersConnecting.com and Creation Illustrated.

Home Page : http://homeschoolopoly.com/

27050.name: Kænguru Ræs!
27050.description: Roll-and-move game for children. Each player represents a kangaroo racing to arrive first at the finish line. Along the route, the players can pick up special cards that are needed to overcome certain obstacle squares.

27051.name: Tell It to the Judge
27051.description: To win, you need to visit eight places (10 points each) and have the fewest demerits (-5 each). Players begin and end at home and move on all rolls except doubles. Doubles change the traffic light spaces in the city portion of the board from red to green (or vice versa). Players cannot move through red lights. If a player lands on a red space (not red light), he is in violation and has to roll to see if he will get a demerit or not. If a player lands on the same space as another player he causes an accident. Five demerits result in having the license revoked.

27052.name: Kiékoi
27052.description:
A board game for children (4+ years).

In their turn, a player picks a card showing an animal. Then they have to find it by touch only from an opaque bag. If they find it before time runs out, they can advance.

27054.name: Matoudematata
27054.description:
A balancing game for children (3+ years). Players stack the cardboard animals into different kinds of towers trying to keep them from falling.

The game comes with 12 pieces: 1 aunt, 4 cats, and 7 smaller presents.

27055.name: Terrific Tagada
27055.description: A racing game for children (3+ years). 6 different cardboard animals and riders are included in the box. They are folded in the middle and a string passed through them and tied to a chair or table. Players then jolt the string up and down so that their animal moves and try to reach the goal first.

27056.name: Aquamemo
27056.description: A waterproof memory game for children (4+ years) to play in the tub. Find the pairs from all the fish floating in the water.

27057.description: A simple roll and move game for children (5+ years). This game is based on Snakes and Ladders, but with players controlling penguins in the Arctic instead.
27057.name: Aglagla

27058.name: Swingolo
27058.description: A simple balancing game for children (5+ years). Players set the wooden bugs on to a big flower that stands on a small base and try to keep it from falling. The game comes with 29 wooden pieces.

27059.name: Space Poker
27059.description: A card game for children (7+ years). This is a Space themed poker game. Players try to get space shuttles or planets, or better still, whole intergalactic sets, in order to win.

27060.name: Mystery Star
27060.description: A card game for children (9+ years). Players have to guess who the Mystery Star is by asking the right questions and paying attention to the questions the others make.

27061.description:
A card game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher: "Game of observation and speed. Pick up an apple, swat a mosquito, place a bee on its flower ? No time to think about ! But for sure, you have to be the first one to do it."

A mosquito, a flower and an apple are placed in front of all the players and each of the players gets his/her own bee. All the cards, showing either a mosquito, a bee or an apple, are dealt to the players. During the game, all the players turn over one of their cards simultaneously. If there are two (or more) of the same cards shown in the newly turned over cards, then the player s to whom the cards belong must get into action:

- If there are 2 or more mosquito cards, they have to squat the mosquito
- If there are 2 or more apple cards, they have to grab the apple
- If there are 2 or more bee cards, they have to take their own bee and put it on the flower

The fastest player wins a ladybird chip. Making an incorrect move, ie squatting the flower or grabbing the mosquito, costs a ladybird chip.

The player with the most ladybird chips when all the cards have been turned over wins the game.
27061.name: Mosquito

27062.name: Pyjama Party
27062.description:
A card game for children (8+ years).

From the publisher: "An incredibly funny girl's game to liven up pyjama parties. Tears of laughters, secrets, revelations : unforgettable moments to share with friends and to write in a secret book."

27063.name: Batabille
27063.description:
A card game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher: "Game of competition and speed.
Round like marbles, the cards follow one another at a hellish rate. Good reflex and observation are necessary to win this fast contest!"

27064.name: Abracadabra
27064.description:
A card game for children (6+ years).

The game is played in teams of 2 players. The goal of each team is to have in their hand the same group of cards without being able to show their hand to each other or say anything about them.

27065.name: Kat'bouille
27065.description:
A card game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher: "Game of observation and speed.
Being able to observe even in a hurry... An important trait if you want to be the first to get 4 identical cards !"

27066.name: Hi! Hi! Hi!
27066.description:
A board game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher:

"A memory and strategy game.
Brave Little Imps cross the dangerous Enchanted Forest. But beware of the horrible Witches. The imps have to evade their evil spells in order to reach Wonderland !"

27067.name: Jungolo
27067.description:
A board game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher:

"Game where you have to be clever like a monkey and have an elephant's memory. Little monkey's jump from tree to tree with different colored coconuts. Difficult to bring back the right coconuts since the monkey's mischievously hide them."

27068.name: Robinetto
27068.description:
A board game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher:

"Game of observation and speed.
Quick, hurry Mr. Plumber! Who will be the fastest to get the water working again ?"

27069.name: Tesoro
27069.description:
A board game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher:

"Amusing strategy game where pirates loot ships to find gold pieces. Who will get the most ?"

27070.name: Zanimatch
27070.description:
A board game for children (5+ years).

From the publisher:

"Game of observation and speed.
You must be quick and stay concentrated!
The first to find an animal on the big card "meli-melo", puts down his/her card quickly, quickly !"

27071.name: Sardines
27071.description:
A card game for children (5+ years) and adults. Excellent for strengthening and building upon the skills introduced in basic memory games but with a twist. Requires players to not only memorize the individual sardines and their characteristics, but to concentrate deeply on their sequence and develop mnemonic devices to help recall the characters and order.

From the publisher:

"Observation and memory game.
You have a couple of seconds to observe the little sardines, memorise them and find them again in the box.!"

27072.name: Pouet! Pouet!
27072.description:
A card game for children (5+ years).

From the publisher:

"Mime and sound game.
The players have to guess what is illustrated on the card by sound or mime...
An ideal game for small children as they don't have to be able to read. Mad laughter guaranteed."

27073.name: Pipolo
27073.description:
A card game for children (5+ years).

From the publisher:

"Bluffing game.
In order to win you have to know how to lie with assurance... And master the notions of space. Underneath or inside ?"

27074.name: Grooaw!
27074.description:
A card game for children (5+ years).

From the publisher:

"Game of battle and strategy.
Strategy, memory , bluffing... The rules and the detail of big games in one astonishing battle for the young children."

27075.name: Mimomirko
27075.description:
A board game for children (5+ years).

From the publisher:

"It is unhelpful to bark when asking the way to the Mirko doghouse. It is better to be skillful in miming a roundabout, a slide, a baker or even Mirko flea... The most talented players to mime and guess will win."

27076.name: Piranhas
27076.description:
A board game for children (5+ years).

From the publisher:

"A terrific fishing game. 18 fish swim leisurely in the water. Which fisherman will catch the most piranhas?"

27077.name: Naviplouf
27077.description:
A board game for children (5+ years).

This is a simplified version of Battleships. Instead of numbers and letters the coordinates are specified in colors and forms (for example: "Red Fish"). The grid is smaller and instead of choosing the places for the boats, there are cards where they are already placed in a random manner.

From the publisher:

"A magnetic naval battle game specially designed for budding young sailors."

27078.name: Yoko-Yoko
27078.description:
A board game for children (5+ years).

From the publisher:

"Game of observation and rapidity. Blue cat, red and green... Blue dog. Who is going to be the faster to catch the right combination! Quick, quick!"

27079.description:
Epoch's 5th game in the "World War Game Series" of operational simulations featuring Japanese involvement. This one deals with the seminal battle of Sekigahara which led to the unification of feudal Japan.

This game is written in Japanese and no translation into English currently exists.

Republished as Sekigahara 1600 by Sunset Games.
27079.name: The Battle of Sekigahara

27080.description:
This expansion to the Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers system adds details for including Soviet forces in your games.

Expands

Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers
27080.name: Disposable Heroes and Coffin for Seven Brothers: Urrahh!
boardgameexpansion: Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers

27082.name: Spitting Fire
27082.description:
Spitting Fire is a pseudo-historical game of aerial combat, set during the turbulent years of World War II.

Between 1939 and 1945, nearly the entire globe became entangled in the most expansive and destructive conflict ever seen. Although responsible for unimaginable terror and tragedy, the war also gave birth to innovation and invention on an unprecedented scale.

With Spitting Fire, players can take control of the aircraft forged in this crucible of conflict, and battle each other in skies the world over! We should state at the outset that those who are aching for a historically-accurate, painstakingly-researched, richly-detailed simulation of World War II dogfights should probably look elsewhere. While such games can be exciting, they aren’t what we had in mind. However, if you want a fast-playing, fun game that gives a nod to history without getting bogged down in historical minutiae, then Spitting Fire is for you.

Spitting Fire is designed to be used with any scale from 1:700 to 1:72 (although larger scales will require a substantial playing area). The rulebook includes data cards for 25 of the most famous fighters from World War II, with others to be released soon!

27083.name: Nya Pratmakarna
27083.description:
Basically a new edition of Pratmakarna, but with four kinds of tasks. Teams of players describe and try to guess words, understand words spoken backwards, and come up with as many words as possible within a time limit.

Contents:
320 cards with 1320 tasks
2 pawns
Clock
Rules

27084.name: Den stora kassaskåpsjakten
27084.description:
Players move around the streets of the city picking up tools they need in order to blow up a bank safe. When all tools have been found, the search for the safe is on. The first player to find it is the winner.

Vaguely connected to the films about Lilla Jönssonligan (Swedish humorous crime stories aimed at kids).

Ages 6 years and up.

Contents:
Game board
24 tool chits
24 tiles
4 pawns
2 dice with 6 labels
Rules

27085.name: Vinna eller försvinna
27085.description:
The title means Win or vanish and this is a light take on disarming bombs. Players are trying to find the bombs and disarm them by finding the correct combination of color tiles in less then 45 seconds.

Contents:
Gameboard
Spinner
4 chit-holders
128 chits
Clock
Pawn
Rules

27086.name: Slam Dunk
27086.description:
From the back of the box:
"For 2 or more players (two teams). Ages 8 to adult.

"There isn't much time left in the Slam Dunk Grand Final, & the opposing team is one point ahead.

"It's your turn but the team cards show your player with the ball has the worst shooting range in the team. Will you turn over a game card & try to pass to your best shooter or will you take a chance with the dice on a fast break. Only you can decide.

"The Slam Dunk Board Game has been created in Australia by professional basketball players. It is a game of strategy, chance & trivia, & reproduces the entire basketball contest with passing, two & three point shots, turnovers, rebounds & fouls.

"As Andrew Gaze says the Slam Dunk Board Game has all the excitement [sic] & action of real Basketball."

27087.name: Defining a Nation: India on the Eve of Independence, 1945
27087.description:
From description: Defining a Nation: India on the Eve of Independence,1945 is set at Simla, in the foothills of the Himalayas, where the British viceroy has invited leaders of various religious and political constituencies to work out the future of Britain’s largest colony. Will the British transfer power to the Indian National Congress, which claims to speak for all Indians? Or will a separate Muslim state—Pakistan—be carved out of India to be ruled by Muslims, as the Muslim League proposes? And what will happen to the vulnerable minorities—such as the Sikhs and untouchables—or the hundreds of princely states? As British authority wanes, smoldering tensions among Hindus, Muslims, and Sikhs increasingly flare into violent riots that threaten to ignite all India. Towering above it all is the frail but formidable figure of Gandhi, whom some revere as an apostle of non-violence and others regard as a conniving Hindu politician. Students struggle to reconcile religious identity with nation building—perhaps the most intractable and important issue of the modern world. Texts include the literature of Hindu revival (Chatterjee, Tagore and Tilak); the Koran and the literature of Islamic nationalism (Iqbal); and the writings of Ambedkar, Nehru, Jinnah, and Gandhi.

As in other Reacting to the Past games, participants are given secret role sheets with victory objectives. Debate and negotiation are the major mechanics used in this game.

27088.name: Henry VIII and the Reformation Parliament
27088.description: From Description: Henry VIII and the Reformation Parliament transforms students into lords and commoners and members of the English parliament during the tumultuous years of 1529-1536. Cardinal Wolsey has just been dismissed as lord chancellor for failing to obtain from the pope the divorce king Henry is seeking from Catherine of Aragon, his wife of twenty years. Thomas More is named as Wolsey’s replacement. More presides over a newly summoned parliament, which the king hopes will somehow find the legal means to annul his marriage to Catherine, thus allowing him to proceed with his plans to marry Anne Boleyn and have by her a male heir. But will parliament find the means, and will it be satisfied with solving the king’s marital and dynastic problems? There are some in parliament who wish to use the royal divorce, as well as the rising anti-clericalism in the land, to effect a split from Rome and a conversion of England from Catholicism to Protestantism. Other members oppose the divorce, oppose making the king head of the English church, and, most of all, oppose this new, heretical creed filtering in from the continent. More is their leader, for as long as he can survive. Thomas Cromwell leads the king’s party. One problem is that the king is ambivalent about the reform effort unleashed by his so called “great matter,” and so the conservatives are free to prosecute reformers as heretics, while the reformers are free to prosecute conservatives as traitors. Conservatives are liable to this charge because their frustration at home tempts them to consider petitioning the king of Spain and Holy Roman Emperor to invade England on behalf of Catholic Europe. The game reaches its dramatic climax around the trial of Anne Boleyn, staged as a grand contest between opposing parties, which parties actually are multiple and fluid. All roles are individualized and most are historically based. At issue is the clash of four contending ideas: medieval Catholicism, Lutheranism, Renaissance humanism, and Machiavellian statecraft. Students read works representative of all traditions.

27089.name: Let's Dance
27089.description:
The title and theme comes from the Swedish TV show, licensed from BBC. So far, the game has only been published in Sweden.

The idea of the show, which is also running in Germany and perhaps other countries, is to have celebrities learning to dance and compete against each other. In the game, players do the same thing, following instructions on the DVD. There are also 225 cards with 1275 trivia questions on dancing, music and movies.

3-5 players or teams, ages 12 and up.

27090.name: Ballongjakten
27090.description:
In "The Balloon Chase" players are trying to find five balloons, one of each color, for their game boards.

3 years and up

The game is published in Sweden under license from Bar-David, but there doesn't seem to be any other edition of the game.

27091.name: N.E.W. Nano Engineered War
27091.description:
N.E.W. Nano Engineered War is a strategy war game that engages players to use nano-technology to simulate ancient creatures from heads, bodies and legs pattern cards. Nanite material is required to create the creatures and each player fights for their individual clan to gain all of the collection material to help their tribe survive. The background of the game is as follows:

The planet Xioc has endured major wars throughout decades of time. The life sustainable resources of the planet have returned to their raw element forms. Air, food, water and plant life is scarce, and only a few humans have survived this mass devastation. Nano-technologies, more specifically molecular sized robots called nanots, were invented prior to the apocalyptic destruction. These self replicating machines along with a special material called nanite is the only way that humans have been able to synthesize small life sustainable ecosystems across the planet. Nanite is found in only trace amounts on the planet and is considered extremely valuable.

Factions and tribes of people living in anarchy, fight for what meager nanite remains. War is no longer waged in taking the life of another human directly, but is decided through nano-engineered war battle arenas. A small amount of battle nanite is used with nanots and pattern cards to create virtual creatures that fight for their tribe. The prize is to win the precious collection nanite that will allow the tribe to continue living.

You are the leaders of your respective clans and are battling to keep your family alive! Good luck.

27092.name: Cry Havoc
27092.description:
Each player has two dice to move around the board which has an Inside and Outside track. A dice on the Inside track must be moved before one on the Outside track. Dice on the Inside track move the number of spaces rolled and try to get back to the Outside track. Dice on the Outside track have more interesting movement options -- (a) move the number rolled, (b) roll 2,3,4,5 and move to that space on the Outside track if it is empty, (c) match a number showing on an opponents dice and take it's place while moving it to the Inside track, (d) roll one less than a number showing on another dice and move to the space just in front of that dice, (e) roll one more than a a number showing on another dice and move to the space just behind that dice. Any move that causes one to land on an opponent's dice, moves that dice to the Inside track.
The game goal is to land one's dice on one's GOAL space on the Oustside track. Each time a player scores a goal, he moves the scoring cube one stage on the scoring track towards his High Stage. The scoring track is in the shape of an X. The four tips of the X are the High Stage for each player. The center of the X is the Zero Stage. If another player scores first, a second scoring player would move the scoring cube back to the Zero Stage. From the Zero Stage, a player would win by scoring 3 consecutive goals.
There is also a short version of the game where the scoring cube is not used and the first player to 3 goals wins.

27093.name: Stormbreaker Alex Rider: The Board Game
27093.description:
Become the hottest new 14 year old spy, Alex Rider, and be the first to complete your mission by hacking your opponents secret code.

Based on the popular book series about the teenage super-spy, this game has players navigating the game board by collecting gadgets and special skills in order to complete various challenges and defeat the enemy.

Collect your assets within the Safe and Mission zones, but be careful when you enter the Caution, Heightened Alert and Danger zones your life could be in jeopardy!

27094.name: Cliff Hanger
27094.description:
Cliff Hanger was one of Airfix's "Carry Case" games, intended to be portable fun!

In this game, players place protruding pegs through a wall set between them, and then hang their men from the pegs, so they cannot see each others pieces.

They then take turns to remove a peg, hoping to dislodge their opponent's men, while retaining theirs. The player with the most men still hanging when there is only one peg remaining wins!

27095.name: The Action Man Game
27095.description:
From the Rules: You command an Action Man force of 19 units. You objective is to put all the opposing forces out of action by capturing all their surviving units and commanders.

The Action Man Game is a simple roll and move game, taking appropriate actions according to the squares landed on. When opposing force commanders land on the same square they must "battle it out" using the special wooden battle dice provided.

27096.name: The Amazing But True Cricket Trivia Game
27096.description:
In the Amazing Cricket Trivia Game players split into two teams.

It is a simple trivia game loosely shaped around the game of cricket to encompass the concept of innings and overs. Each question correctly answered is rewarded with the roll of a die to see how many runs have been scored.

27097.name: The Car Boot Game
27097.description:
Each player sets out to buy or acquire sale item cards to sell at a profit. Each sale item provides the player with some profit, some items are "collector's items", providing a large profit.

First to reach an agreed total wins.

This is a simple "roll and move" game.

27098.name: Krimi Total Fall 5: Der Mythos der Familie
27098.description:
Translation: "The myth of the family"

A murder mystery game playing in the 1930's in a little town near Chicago. Mobster boss Don Pedro Calliente is earning a fortune by smuggling alcohol. But in the last couple of days a lot of murders happened because of the return of the Morelli brothers.

Don Pedro has ordered important members of his family to his house for a secret meeting. The future of the family is at stake...

All players (4 male, 4 female + 1 optional m/f) should be dressed up and act out their role to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer (who is the only person allowed to lie).

27099.description:
This is the 7th expansion in the Dungeon Twister series of games.

It will add many natural elements in the maze, like elf archers, trees, secret passages, a druid, magical plants and some powerful items.

Expands

Dungeon Twister
27099.name: Dungeon Twister: Créatures Sylvestres

27101.description:
(from GMT website:)

The Night War Over the Reich, 1943-1945

"We all love him; he's so bloody inhuman."
- A 5 Group squadron commander on Sir Arthur 'Bomber' Harris

March 1944. More than 700 British bombers are dispatched to the distant city of Nürnberg. As the bomber stream crawls across the German Reich, it is set upon by swarms of nightfighters. Following the bombers' contrails the figthers infiltrate the stream in great numbers and before the moon can set they pick off bomber after bomber. The mauled stream makes a desultory attack on the target city, scattering much of their payload of high explosive and incendiaries harmlessly into the surrounding countryside. Then the raid struggles bak towards England while fresh formations of nightfighters snap and bite at the retreating formation. More than ninety bombers fail to make it home safely. Soon afterward, the C-in-C of Bomber Command, Arthur "Bomber" Harris, calls off the Battle of Berlin.

BOMBER COMMAND is a game of the night war in the skies over the Reich in World War II.
The game recreates the great RAF bombing raids against the heart of Germany and the defence of the German Luftwaffe's night fighter arm.

Based on an air combat system derived from the award-winning Downtown and The Burning Blue 'raid-scale' games, Bomber Command details the tactics of night fighting.

The German player must manage flak, Himmelbett zones, Wild Boar and Tame Boar tactics. RAF 'main force' raids are supported by Mosquito diversions, "Gardening" operations (mining of seaways) and decoy raids. Two card decks--one for each player--are used to resolve the complex interactions of electronic countermeasures and radars, along with other operational factors such as Mahmoud patrols, Flower raids, and Beleuchter illumination units. A detailed bombing resolution system depicts the difficulties of marking targets and area bombing at night.

There are two scenarios:

1. Berlin covers raiding from the 1943 Hamburg firestorm to the great Battle of Berlin and the RAF's defeat over Nuremburg in March 1944.

2. Downfall recreates the period from the Summer of 1944 to the collapse of the Luftwaffe in the face of fuel shortages and the RAF's "bomber support" effort.

The game is fast-playing and raids typically resolve in 2 hours or less.

COMPONENTS

One 8.5" x 11" Play Aid Card (2-sided)
One 8.5" x 11" Bombing Card (2-sided)
One 8.5" x 11" Planning Map (2-sided)
One sheet of 5/8" counters & markers
One sheet of 1/2" counters & markers
Four 8.5" x 11" City Map Sheets
One deck of 55 British cards
One deck of 55 German cards
One Rule book
One Play book
Two 22" x 34" maps




DESIGNER: Lee Brimmicombe-Wood
MAP & COUNTER ART: Lee Brimmicombe-Wood
AIRCRAFT ART: Ian Wedge
27101.name: Bomber Command

27103.name: Spökjägarna
27103.description:
Players are trying to catch the ghost in the mansion. First they must track down the ghost, and then convince the owner of the mansion to let them use a gadget to catch the ghost. Meanwhile, players will also try to stop their opponents. Finally, they need to catch the ghost. The first player to do this is the winner.

Contents:
6 pawns
6 tiles
Gameboard
6 gadgets
2 dice
various chits
a cloth bag

6 years and up

27105.name: Dungeon Tricks
27105.description: 4 player Trick Taking card game with a Fantasy Dungeon-Crawl Theme. There are 4 Suits: Treasures, Monsters, Heroes, and Traps. Monsters Trump Treasures, Heroes Trump Monsters, and Traps Trump Heroes. Players score after all tricks are taken. Treasures & Heroes are Positive. Monsters & Traps are Negative. Highest total positive score wins the round. Win 2 rounds to win the game. Some cards have extra Trump taking Ability. A complete copy of the Rules is available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/DUT.html

27106.name: The Authentic DaVinci Dilemma
27106.description:
From the back of the box:

The Authentic Da Vinci Dilemma is an exciting new board game that tests your Da Vinci knowlege while creating a timeless masterpiece. Players are challenged to a series of Da Vinci Riddles and trivia from four categories: Earth, Air, Water and Man. The correct answers to these challenges allow players to win a piece of the puzzle, moving them one step closer toa solution and the creation of a Da Vinci Masterpiece.

27107.name: Twin Cities
27107.description:
The object of the game is to choose two city sites across the river from each other and join them with a minimum of six road pieces and one bridge. The city sites are placed at the intersection of hexagonal pieces which have numbers on them, and each turn dice are rolled and cities adjacent to pieces with the rolled numbers produce resources, just as in Catan. Also as in Settlers, players trade resources with each other and then use them to build roads and bridges. Unlike Settlers, Twin Cities uses three dice with 1-5 and a question mark on the faces; rolling question marks gives you action cards, and rolling certain combinations has special effects.

Game contents include:
12 city pieces
66 interlocking plastic board pieces
8 board frame pieces
360 resource cards
85 action cards
72 road pieces
24 bridge pieces
3 dice
1 board piece bag

27108.description:
A regular Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

This small expansion Set "Anno Domini - Fussball WM" contains only 54 events related to Soccer Worldcups. As it is conceived as a free give away (on occasion of the 2006 Worldcup in Germany) it consists only of those 54 cards (no rules, only cards in shrinkwrap). These are to few for a regular game, but can be added to any other games of the series.

In 2008, this expansion was included in "Anno Domini - Jubiläums Metallbox", a metal box designed to hold 8 regular Anno Domini games. It has no own entry on BGG.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly. Anno Domini is a blast to play, it is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Part of the Anno Domini series
boardgameversion: Abacus "Anno Domini: Jubiläums Metallbox" German Edition
27108.name: Anno Domini: Fussball WM

27109.name: Propertunity
27109.description:
Players are property developers seeking to achieve the pre-determined victory conditions by aquiring property and selling at a profit. Income is gained from holding properties and getting rent,but along the way disasters can befall the struggling developer and there are the ever-present expenses to be paid. The winner is the first to achieve the pre-arranged victory conditions; these are agreed by the players and range from playing for a time limit to holding x number of properties and x amount of cash; thus the game length is variable based on the time avaiable.

The game is produced and published privately.

Home Page: http://www.Propertunity.com

27110.name: Think Negative! The Aids Prevention Game
27110.description:
A standard roll and move trivia game with questions and open thought issues discussing Aids, sexual health, contraceptives, and so on.

Available in English, French, and German.

27112.description:
This supplement of Memoir '44 offers experienced players the unique opportunity to replay historical WWII battles on a grand scale, with up to four players to a side.

This style of play, called Memoir '44 Overlord, combines multiple board maps into a single, oversized battlefield. To play it requires this free downloadable game supplement, and at least two copies of the game.

With Memoir '44 Overlord, players can experience the frustrations associated with being part of a military-style WWII chain of command and, at the same time, enjoy the challenges of coordination and cooperation needed to gain victory.

From the description at the Memoir '44 site, where the rules are available.
boardgameversion: Days of Wonder English PDF edition
27112.name: Memoir '44: Overlord

27113.name: The Crime Club Card Game
27113.description: The game contains 50 cards – 6 suits of 8 cards (split into 3 detective and 3 crook suits featuring characters – such as Hercule Poirot – objects and locations) and 2 jokers. The game is played in two parts. During the first part of the game players collect a hand that will enable them, during the second part of the game, to take as few tricks as possible.

27114.name: Follow Me
27114.description: A childrens' game where players take turns putting discs into a pile in the center. Each disc shows one of several variations of a smiley face and will have one of four background colors. Players must lay a disc showing either the same face or color as the previous disc.

27115.name: Qwijit
27115.description:
Qwijit is an abstract strategy game where you place stones on a grid. It comes with two games. In the first, you are attempting to capture the Qwijit stone in the center of the grid. In the second, you want to place more stones than your opponent.

Qwijit was originally produced as a gift to the attendees of Mike Young's wedding. It is now available a free print-and-play game at http://www.interactivitiesink.com/cardgames

27116.name: Hell & Fateful decisions
27116.description:
Rules for company to battalion level, from 1919 to 1999.

Scales

1 vehicle, 1 infantry squad (circa 10 men)
1" = 50 meters
No stated timescale

A simple set of miniatures rules which places the emphasis strongly on the motivation of troops rather than the technical capabilities of their weapons.
This is essentially the big brother of "Hell by Daylight" the author's 20th century skirmish rules set.

Rules cover; troop types, terrain, visibility, night, command and orders, small arms fire, states of being, casualties and morale, indirect fire, close combat, anti tank fire, anti aircraft fire, aircraft, mines, snipers and booby traps.

At the end there is a very short variant "Kalashnikov Tribal" for combats between 3rd world warlords and the like. Finally there are three scenarios; one in Vietnam, one in Afghanistan (Soviet occupation era), and one in Italy (1944).

27117.description:
This game was designed and then published as a contract order from a Swiss insurance company ASSURA SA. It is intended to promote one of their product, ANIMALIA, an insurance for pets and animals.

One of the goals set early in the process was to design a "real game", not a mere advertising product, playable with the whole family. That's how the game ended up being playable for 2 to 6 players, age 7 and up. It's a light card game, which is enjoyable among adults and children alike, the latter ones having a chance of winning thanks to the luck factor induced by card-drawing.

"You're determined to be awarded the title of Best Breeder and you have three season to win as many medals as you can with your show animals. But beware, your opponents are all trying to do the same thing and they certainly won't hesitate to use their animals' special powers to spoil your plans. Stay alert, keep an eye on your opponents' animals as well as your own - and see who gets to the top of the medal table!"

The players are animal-breeders who compete to present the finest collection of show-animals over the
course of 3 seasons and each season is split into 3 phases. In the first phase, players take turns drafting 5 animals into their collection. In the second phase, players compare the elegance of their animals by counting the stars at the top of their cards. Bonuses are awarded to the 2 players with the most elegant animal collections. Medals are awarded in phase 3 at the end of each season. Players earn animal medals for having multiple animals of the same family, or 5 different animals. The breeder with the highest number of medals at the end of the third season is declared the winner!
27117.name: Animalia

27118.name: Spilungo
27118.description:
Very simple children game. Players draw tiles and place them to complete the teddy bear body. The player who first completes the teddy bear wins.
Recommended age is 4+.

27119.name: Den Store Klassekamp
27119.description:
It's the first day of school, and children are trying to get into the classroom as late as possible so that they will get the seats in the back (farther away from the teacher).

This is a roll-and-move dice game. Each player gets a secret objective card stating the desired seat for each child; at the end of the game, each player scores points only for the kids that are seated according to his/her objective card (the seats in the back being more valuable than the seats in the front).

27120.description:
Miniature wargame rules for Corps level Napoleonic games.

From the TooFatLardies website:

Le Feu Sacre places command and control above musket calibre and march rates. They are aimed at gamers who wish to experience a large scale battle at the battalion level. Players command Corps and Divisions, and maneuver by brigade, regiment or battalion. Avoiding the usual omnipresent control that players are so often allowed over the minutiae of battle, Le Feu Sacré concentrates on encouraging historically correct grand tactics. Also included are historical orders of battle for 8 example Corps d'Armee.

The rules use the familiar TooFatLardies card driven system. The Lardies' emphasis on battlefield "friction" allows the better, bolder generals to take the initiative, and recover from unexpected reverses, whilst less competent, cautious commanders need to stick to predictable battle plans, or risk coming unstuck. We present to you a set of rules where Austrian troops can be the equal of the French, but the Empire can still repeat history! Vive l'Empereur!
27120.name: Le Feu Sacre

27121.name: Kiss Me, Hardy
27121.description: Napoleonic naval miniature wargame rules intended for 1/1200 scale ships but usable for other scales. Turn sequence is card driven and the rules place the player at approximately Admiral level and thus the rules are intended to replicate decision making at that level (i.e. no need to worry about sail settings or ammunition types). Hence the rules are simple and quick.

27122.name: Zing! Gift Card Edition
27122.description:
Let the stories begin…..Zing! gives you a delicious set of words (with three difficulty levels). With those and a few of your own, you develop a sentence. You’ll score points for every Zing! word you use. Players take turns adding to your sentence until you have a story!

Can’t write? You’ll be surprised… Zing! brings you in and gets you creating, writing and laughing in a flash! Discover new ways of thinking. The outcome is, well, ZING!

And when the stories have been told (after a few twists and turns) the player with the most points wins!

This version is in a small travel tin.

27123.name: Lee at the Crossroads
27123.description: Lee at the Crossroads is a brigade level study of the 3 day battle of Gettysburg in early July, 1863. The players are placed in the positions of the leaders of the opposing Armies with leadership and command control systems modeled on the strengths and weaknesses of Civil War era command techniques as well as the influences of the participating individual commanders. Turns represent 2 hours of daylight and 5 hours of darkness. Hexes are scaled to 350 yards.
