• New space fighters
- Dracula
- Predator
- Spectre
- Strella
- Spectre II
- Strella II
• 'IWo refits
- Deathwind HCR
- Salamander HCR
27252.name: Silent Death House: House Colos
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition

boardgameimplementation: Silent Death Annex: Rules of Warfare
27253.description:
From the back cover:

RULES OF WARFARE II
" Ha!" screamed Erik as disrupter gun fire flashed through the space beside his Marut. With just a squeeze his impulse gun scored a ravaging hit against the offending Chupacabra. The mangled Chupy tumbled through space scattering un-launched missiles like a trail of breadcrumbs behind it. With a flick of his wrist Erik saluted his fallen opponent "Bye-bye goat sucker."

Rules of Warfare II (ROW 11) is the Silent Death supplement for scheduling tournaments, and organizing Silent Death Events.

Rules of Warfare II includes:
• The Rules of Warfare II official tournament guidelines
• Pre=constructed ROW II fleets for:
- Prize Ships - Kashmere
- ASP - Espan
- Sunrunner - Sigurd
- Yoka-Shan - Fighter Tactics
• Crew allocation system optional rule
• A House based league system
• Full color counter sheets
• A fold-out map for tabletop play
• A Millennium Warriors ranking program update
• Refits for the Silent Death prize ships:
- Dolphin II
- Orca Alpha
- Piranha II
- Executioner II
- Snarling Badger II
• The official Millennium Warrior event sanctioning procedure
• 2 Smash style events: - 4 Ship Smash - House Smash
27253.name: Silent Death Annex: Rules of Warfare II
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition

27254.description:
From the back cover:

Escorts do the grunt work..
" Yeee-Haw!" came the scream across the headset.
" Pipe down; Mike, some of us are trying to concentrate!"
Will yelled back as he squeezed off another salvo of
missiles toward the fleeing Imperial Nighthawks. "We have 'em on the run. Don't let 'em get away." "They're trying to use that moon for cover."
" Mike take your wing left to cut them off" "Will, it..."

A flash of blue light lit the canopy as the Talon exploded. Will glanced at the moon. Rising from its horizon came the imposing silhouette of a Mega-fortress.

Escort vessels-corvettes, frigates, and destroyers-are the true workhorses of all interstellar navies. This supplement adds the escort vessel class of ships to the deadly universe of Silent Death. Escorts do the grunt work of the navy, serving as long-range patrol craft, picket ships, convoy and fleet escorts, fighter tenders, assault transports, blockade runners and more. This book contains all the info you'll need to incorporate these ships into your Silent Death games. Warhounds includes:

• Rules for escort class vehicles, escort class scenarios, an escort campaign
• Ship design rules for Warhounds
• New weapons for escort class ships .
• Ship displays for: Aosho, Constellation, Fletcher, Megafortress, Narwhal, Stingray, Narwhal Ill, Longboat, Ushas, Kali, Nebula II, Pteradon, Cetshwayo
27254.name: Silent Death Tech: Warhounds
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition

27255.name: Silent Death House: Sigurd Archdiocese
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
27255.description:
From the back cover:

Guttman's battle orders boomed from the com units of the Sigurd Carrier Wing T-01 "Thor's Hammer." There was no sound of doubt or fear, only fury that the Brood would enter Midgard space. "Bach's Symphony, break to intercept the forward elements. Odin's Anvil proceed with me to primary targets. Make them pay with blood, no Brood survivors."
The Brood have swept through human domains like a vengeful plague and the Promethians hold sway over many of the Twelve. The faithful of the,Church of Odin believe that only they can stand against these brutal foes and their evil encroachment on human space. Though some call the Midgardians fanatics, willing to throw their lives away for the visions of a madman, they know what is to come.

Sigurd Archdiocese shows the Church of Odin's rise to power in the Next Millennium and the rebirth of the church through the strength and charisma of Gunther Guttman.
Sigurd Archdiocese includes:

• 5 new Sigurd fighter displays
- Hound
- Hammer
- Iceberg
- Dagger
- Storm
• 1 Sigurd escort
- Longboat
• 4 Sigurd refit fighters
- Pit Viper II
- Glaive III
- Spirit Rider III
- Storm II
• 6 Scenarios staging 10 battles
• New Sigurd weaponry for fighters and escorts
• Church of Odin history and timeline
• Descriptions of Archdiocese fighter wings

27256.name: Silent Death House: ASP Technocracy
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
27256.description:
From the back cover:

"SCIENCE FIRST HUMANITY SECOND"
" We're under attack and need help immediately. I repeat immediate response requested.' "Who is the aggressor, Red Hawk patrol?"
Before Wolf could answer, yet another alarm beeped insistently through the smoky blaring cockpit. This one spelled doom for his Lurching unresponsive Night Hawk-missile lock and launch.
" Technocracy ships." Wolf spat as the missiles closed. "They've got some kind of smart torpedo. Tell everyone to watch out for..."
A scream finished his sentence as a barrage of missiles pounded his ship, blowing it into a thousand pieces of twisted metal.

ASP Technocracy presents the near destruction of one of the Terran Empire's most influential houses, and its post-Imperial rise to dominance.

ASP Technocracy includes:
• 5 new ASP fighter wings
• 3 new basic scenarios with maps
• 2 new advanced scenarios with maps
• A comprehensive ASP time line and history
• New ASP weapon systems:
- Entropic Accelerator - Graviton Cannon
- C Torpedoes - Parasite Torpedoes
• Four new Space Fighters:
- Binary -Nova
-Pulsar -Quark
• Two new Warhounds:
-Nebula II -Pteradon
• Two refits:
- Spirit Rider IV -Shryak Shuttle III

27257.name: Silent Death Races: Night Brood First Contact
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
27257.description:
From the back cover:

FIRST CONTACT
'Alright, people, settle down. We haven't got a clue about what we're up against here. What we believe to be advance elements of their main fleet encountered one of our patrols yesterday morning. Friendly contact was lost, but not before we got an N-sweep of the aggressor vessels," the Ops Commander took a deep breath. "Configuration, unknown. Composition, unknown. Armaments, unknown. Occupants, unknown. Good tech, eh? What a surprise. What we do know is that they waxed our guys, and Deep Scan says more intruders are on the way. Plenty more, and soon. Questions?"
-Briefing segment

First Contact shows the initial confrontation with the Grubs, a bellicose alien race intent on the destruction of mankind. They swarm through deep space ravaging planet after planet. Night Brood: First Contact is a revision of the 1992 Night Brood Release.

Night Brood: First Contact includes:

• Rules for using Grub ships and weapons
• Night Brood scenarios
• Brood campaign guidelines
• 188 counters for Brood ships, Drones, Wormholes, and special equipment.
• Displays for 10 Brood ships
- Muskellunge
- Squidge
- Manta
- Dragonfly
- Shaggai
- Larva
- Lamprey
- Remora
- Tigermoth
- Thistle

27258.name: Silent Death Forces: More Than Valor
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
27258.description:
From the front cover:

...beyond demand or foresight..
The Fighter Tactics Manual bounced off the desk in an explosion of paper that finally careened to a stop at the feet of "Blindspot" O'Brien. "Rough night, Strack?" he said, addressing the rookie who had launched the book. "My answers matched the manual, word for blasted word! Instructor Waite failed me anyway!" Blindspot sighed. "You just don't get it, do you? There's more to being an ace than the ability to quote the FTM."

All the stuff you need to flesh out the pilots in your Silent Death games:

• Experience system plus skills & quirks system
• Rules for creating Aces, House by House
• New ships: Samurai, Hayabusa
• Nifty refits: Shark, Seraph, Talon, Death Wind, Salamander, Nemesis, Hellbender, Sorenson, Nemesis, Lance Electra, Revenge, Drakar, Quark, Black Widow, Sentry, & Viper

27259.name: Silent Death Annex: Operation – Dry Dock
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
27259.description:
From the front cover:

ID flags appeared under the blips on Rand's screen as the Commander's voice broke the silence. "Two Glaives coming in range. Hold your torps! They are out of protobolts and there is no way they can tag us with their Plazguns from this..." He was cut off as an lon Ram from the lead Glaive slammed into his ship. The second Glaive quickly followed suit and the Commander's ship disappeared in an lon storm.

Since the Fall of the Empire over a decade ago, many standard Imperial ship designs have become commonplace. Almost every fleet has a few Salamanders. However, within the past five years most of these ships have undergone refits more suited to the fighting styles of the houses using them. Operation: Dry Dock reveals 23 previously unseen ship variants, and provides updated sheets for the original 26 fighters.

Operation: Dry Dock includes:
• 23 new Terran fighter variants
• 26 updated Terran fighters
• 6 updated Escort displays
• Tonnage on every ship display
• Escort rules clarifications
• Optional rules

27260.name: Silent Death Forces: Universal Night Watch
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
27260.description:
From the back cover:

A ball of panic surged in Justin's throat as the wounded Muskellunge appeared within the Ink Cloud off the port side of his Rattler. Though his HUD wouldn't track through that black chemical soup, he opened up with his Splatterguns. No hit.

Seconds later his boards lit up as the commander's Falcon achieved an accurate scan pinpointing the exact location of the Muskellunge deep within the cloud. This time his Splatterguns did their work with grizzly efficiency, leaving the Muskellunge a mangled corpse hanging in the dark space.
Through sharing resources, technologies, and intelligence, the Twelve created a brotherhood for the defense of mankind. The Universal Night Watch was founded for the sole purpose of insuring humanity's survival against the assault of the Night Brood, horrors from beyond Terran space. There are no forces with better training or equipment, and none more willing to risk their lives for mankind's.

UNIVERSAL NIGHT WATCH includes:
• New weapons and technology for fighting the Brood
• 12 Universal Night Watch Scenarios
• 2 New Brood Ships
- Muckworm
- Vartak
• 1 escort class ship
- Falcon
• 6 new Terran fighters
- Hornet
- Praying mantis
- Equalizer
- Rattler
- Javelin
- Firebat

27261.name: Silent Death Expansion: Night Brood
27261.description:
From the back cover:

A gruesome new menace stirs on the periphery of known space. Armed with devastating technologies and a thirst for mayhem, these Hatchling aliens (known simply as Grubs), burst forth from their hidden Clutch-worlds. Millions of them, including an overwhelming contingent of bio-mechanical starfighters, embark on a sector-wide rampage. In their path stand a few isolated frontier planets with a rag-tag collection of out-dated fighters and ordnance.

Emergency calls go out to Imperial garrisons hundreds of light years away. The Terrans muster their far-flung forces, but every delay brings the fall of another frontier world.
The clock is ticking, the Hatchlings are gaining strength, and this crisis is rapidly spinning out of control!
Night Brood chronicles the events of the First Hatchling Scourge — the invasion of the Tau Albriton Frontier Sector and the subsequent Imperial relief effort.

Night Brood, designed for use with the Silent Death Metal Express game, system, includes the following:

• 6 new Hatchling starfighter metal miniatures, with bases. These allow you to play the first four Night Brood scenarios.
• Starcraft Displays for several new Hatchling starfighters, including the Larva,'" Remora,'" Squidge,'" Lamprey,-Manta,`' and Muskellunge.'"*
• Background information on the Terran Star Empire, the Frontier, and, of course, the enigmatic Hatchling aliens.
• Descriptions of eight Terran starfighter wings and eight Hatchling fighter swarms.
• Eight complete scenarios, and a design-your-own campaign that pits the Grubs against their Terran opponents.
• The Night Brood Rules Annex which describes the technologies and capabilities of this dangerous race.
• Color counters for Night Brood and Black Guard.

27262.name: Silent Death: Black Guard – The Ptolemean Wars Continue
27262.description:
From the back cover:
BLACK GUARD:THE PTOLEMEAN WARS CONTINUE

" Let Operation Hurricane Begin!"
With these words, Marshal Beznikov ushered in the final Colosian assault on the Ptolemean Homeworld.
As chronicled in the first Silent Death expansion, Overkill, the dire Ptolemean Wars began with invasions from Houses Colos and Dneprodzerkutsk. Now, after nearly a year of desperate fighting, the Colosian Fleet is ready to take the capital of House Ptolemus in one final, cataclysmic battle.
Is the fate of House Ptolemus sealed? Will it pass into the void, cast out of the Imperium as a depleted renegade power?
Not if their last few fighter pilots have anything to say about it!

Black Guard chronicles the climactic battle which closes out Imperial Year 475 and marks a significant turning point in the Ptolemean Wars. Black Guard, designed for use with the Silent Death ™™ Metal Express ™ game, includes the following:

• Starcraft Displays for four new fighters and two new gunboats: including the Dart™, Talon™, Lance Electra™, Sentry™, Star Raven™, and the awesome Betafortress™. *
• Revised and reissued Starcraft Displays for every fighter and gunboat which has appeared in Silent Death and Overkill. These new updated displays incorporate Optional Rule material, such as the number of Decoys carried and the quality of each vessel's Point-Defense munition system.
• Historical Summaries and Orders of Battle for four new fighter wings: Black Guard and the Brothers Of Enmity fly for House Ptolemus, while Gale Force and Monsoon fight for the invading Colosians.
• Four new scenarios pit Ptolemean and Colosian forces against one another deep in the crucial Hathor system.
• Rules Annex #2 for Silent Death provides guidelines for playing this game in 3-D, using Point-Defense systems against Missile Salvos, and more.
• Color renderings of unit badges and more starcraft paint schemes.

Expands:

Silent Death

27263.name: Silent Death: Overkill – The Ptolemean Wars
27263.description:
OVERKILL:THE PTOLEMEAN WARS

The star-spanning Province of Great House Ptolemus as been invaded by the Colosian Deep Space Fleet. Other war mongering hoards from the Black Plague and Behemoth war bands have staked their claim to Ptolemean worlds. The first provincial outposts have been overrun. Desperate pleas for help crackle over a far-flung net of Tachyon Beam Dictors Interstellar war is at hand.

Squadrons of fast, deadly starfighters fly in the vanguard of these conquering legions. Armed with Disruptoguns, Ion Rams, and "The Undisputed Right of Engagement," they will get first crack at the enemy.

Overkill: The Ptolemean Wars is a grand campaign designed for the Silent Death Metal Express game. In here you will find
• Starcraft Displays for five new Silent Death fighters and two new gunboats: including the Blizzard, Kosmos, Hell Bender Death Wind, Glaive and Drakar
• Blank Starcraft Displays or designing your own Silent Death vessel.
• Complete background and .campaign maps for he Ptolemean Wars.
• Detailed histories and Orders of Battle for twelve: new Fighter Wings.
• Twelve challenging Silent Death scenarios and two campaigns.
• Rules Annex# 1 for Silent Death, which provides guidelines for new Cannons, Projectors, Warheads, Pilot Luck, Life Pods, Gunboat Class vessels and more.
A fume sheet of 180 new color counters displaying new fighters, torps, missiles and other Silent Death game markers.

Expands:

Silent Death

27265.name: Silent Death: Rookie Rules
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
27265.description:
THE dumbed-down version of Silent Death for the next generation!

From the back of the box:

Hawk eyed his instruments as his squadron sped towards the marauders. "Get your Talon back into formation, Parker." "I saw something in the asteroid field, going to confirm." "Negative, Parker, back in line."
" Almost there . . ."
Across the void Hawk saw the flare of thrusters ignite as his board lit up. The bogie was a Nighthawk.
" Abort Parker! Abort!"

The massive guns of the Nighthawk flashed across the asteroid field like a small sun and Parker's ship vanished in silent fury. Some rookies never live to learn.
Silent Death is an exciting, quick-playing, and
easy-to-learn star fighter combat game. In Silent Death, your star fighters and their proud and cunning pilots will combat enemy forces in the vastness of space.

Here is everything you'll need to begin the Silent Death experience! This set includes a subset of the rules and components from Silent Death: The Next Millennium, while still allowing for a wide diversity of weapon types, crew quality, and tactical situations.

Rookie Rules includes:
• Streamlined rules from Silent Death: The Next Millennium
• Starcraft display book
• 6 rookie scenarios
• Set of 9 polyhedral dice
• plastic missiles, torpedoes, and asteroids
• 'Itivo 24" x 36" fold out hex maps
• 24 plastic ships (2 each of 12 different designs) + bases

27266.description:
From the publisher website:

Silent Death: The Next Millennium is an exciting, quick-playing, and easy-to-learn table-top game of star fighter combat set against the backdrop of a disintegrating high-tech empire in the far future.

The universe of Silent Death: TNM is our own future 9,000 years from now. Space travel is common for those species that hold the technology, and humans have come to live on hundreds of worlds all across the Orion arm of our galaxy.

This Deluxe Box Set allows for a wide diversity of weapon types, crew quality, and tactical situations. Exciting new features include ship-building rules that allow you to design ships from scratch and 24 updated, beautifully illustrated ship designs.
27266.name: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death Annex: Fighter Tactics Manual
Silent Death Annex: Operation – Dry Dock
Silent Death Annex: Rules of Warfare
Silent Death Annex: Rules of Warfare II
Silent Death Campaign Supplement: Renegades – the Espan Rebellion
Silent Death Forces: More Than Valor
Silent Death Forces: Universal Night Watch
Silent Death House: House Falstaff – Origins and Rise
Silent Death House: Q'raj Void Protectorate
Silent Death Races: Night Brood First Contact

27267.name: Silent Death: Wings of Death
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
27267.description:
From the back of the box:

Wings of Death contains 48 finely crafted silver-plastic space fighters sculpted by the renowned Bob Naismith. Designed for play with ICE's explosive Silent Death spaceship combat game, these ships can also be used with any other space combat game or RPG.

You get 4 each of 12 different designs, the same vessels included in the Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition. Each ship comes with its own black, hex-shaped plastic stand. They fly well and look great unfinished, but they are even cooler painted with acrylic or enamel colors.

This boxed set contains the same plastic ships which are included in the Silent Death: The Next Millennium boxed set. There are four of each of these ships:

Blizzard
Dart
Hell Bender
Kosmos
Lance Electra
Night Hawk
Pit Viper
Salamander
Spirit Rider
Talon
Teal Hawk
Thunder Bird

Expands:

Silent Death

27268.name: Silent Death Annex: Hangar 51
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
27268.description:
Description from ICE's website:

This is the first PDF-only Annex for Silent Death: The Next Millenium! This exclusive PDF Annex for Silent Death contains the complete ship sheets for all 228 Silent Death ships, including the Dolphin, Orca, Piranha, Executioner and Snarling Badger prize ships.

Expands:

Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition

27269.description:
From ICE's website description:

How does an eccentric tinkerer's retirement hideaway become a small but powerful noble house minor? Follow 3 simple rules: Get up early, work hard, and stumble across a super-secret prototype fighter that everybody wants. Oh…and you also have to deal with the fallout from that unfortunate incident in which a Colosian Viscount suddenly found himself on the wrong side of an airlock. And if you can fend off the odd pirate raid, keep the Luches Utopia off you back, and continue to run a growing commercial enterprise, you’ve got it made.

Follow the adventures & follies of House Falstaff, the latest addition to the colorful gallery of players in the universe of Silent Death: The Next Millennium. This 26-pg PDF introduces 3 brand-new ships, 2 refits, & 4 game scenarios.

Expands:

Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
27269.name: Silent Death House: House Falstaff – Origins and Rise
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition

boardgameimplementation: Silent Death Annex: Rules of Warfare II
27270.description: This is the Silent Death Supplement for running tournament and events.
27270.name: Silent Death Annex: Rules of Warfare
boardgameexpansion: Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition

27271.name: Derby
27271.description: Belgian Soccer game released in the '80s. It was based upon the now legendary derby matches between Standard Liege and the defunct Club Liège (Club Luik).

27272.name: Met. Office weather game
27272.description: Designed with advice from the Met. Office, this game introduces people to the weather concepts of temperature, pressure and wind. Each player is given a card with an activity related to a certain weather condition. The player wins by being the first to travel round the UK, while attempting to collect the correct weather conditions.

27273.description:
The six scenarios in this package are representative of the many combat actions which the Waffen-SS subjected their European enemies to. Statistically, the German Army proved to be the most formidable armed forces ever known to modern warfare. At the end of the war, statistics showed that, regardless of whether the German ground forces won a battle or lost it, whether they outnumbered their enemy or even if they, themselves, were outnumbered, the German Army inflicted fifty percent more casualties on the enemy than they suffered. The Waffen-SS units were even deadlier by doubling what their Army counterparts achieved. Within this package you will see just how awesome was their fight.

These scenarios represent the Waffen-SS as hunter and hunted, hero and hated. They are some of the most vicious battles fought during World War II, and they cover the full spectrum of the Allied fight against Hitler. The great effort with which it took to liberate Europe from the fists of the Waffen-SS can be fully appreciated within this package.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader




Expanded by:

Waffen-SS II: Fuhrer's Firemen
27273.name: Waffen-SS: No Quarter No Glory
boardgameexpansion: HOB Update - SS I / SS II

27274.name: Mammalian Mayhem
boardgamepublisher: HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company)
27274.description:
Excerpt from rules introduction:

"Mammalian Mayhem "is a companion and sequel to our popular Saurian Safari dinosaur hunting rules. It is not just a supplement, though, but a complete rule system in its own right. As the title suggests, it enables the players to expand their hunting activities into the Age of Mammals, and to take on a wide range of quarry - living, extinct or simply mysterious - from prehistoric saber-tooths to modern African big game.

Each player may choose to control either a human hunter character, or an animal. The hunters move, shoot etc. in a fairly conventional "skirmish wargame" sort of way, by means of dice, while for the animal players we have introduced a card driven system, using an ordinary pack of playing cards. The intention is to bring out the difference between human intelligence - as represented, however unlikely it may sound, by the wargamer - and that of the quarry, who should combine a limited range of tactical options with an element of unpredictability. To compensate for this, the animals will usually be able to move faster than the hunters, and will have a decisive advantage if they manage to get to close range."

27275.name: Monopoly: Fifa World Cup 2006 Germany
27275.description: The 2006 World Cup edition of Monopoly. All the national soccer teams that participated in this sporting event are represented on the board.

27276.description:
Car Wars Arena presents 11 arena designs and scenarios to go with each of them. In addition, two new Division 15 vehicle designs and a large selection of counters (including small fold-up bunkers and towers) are included to make your games more exciting. Car Wars Arena also includes rules for AADA League Combat and Gold Cross Cloning.

Like the Car Wars Starter Sets, this book is designed to be taken apart. The inside front cover has two new Vehicle Sheets. The back cover has more counters for your game, including those needed for the two new vehicles. The center counter sheet includes fold-up bunkers (in which drivers and vehicle crew may hide) and tall TV towers.

Car Wars Arena is a supplement. You need at least one Car Wars starter set to play.

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
Car Wars (fifth edition)
27276.name: Car Wars Arena Book 1

27277.name: Monkey Business
27277.description:
A children's game from ELC. Very similar to Monkeying Around. Spin the spinner to see how many of your monkeys you may hang on the palm tree (or if you must hang one of the heavy gorillas instead). Think before you place your monkeys because, if you are not careful, the tree will collapse and the monkeys will tumble into the crocodile infested pond below. First one to hang all their monkeys on the tree wins.

Similar to:

Hanging Monkies
Monkeying Around

27278.name: Greedy Gorilla
27278.description:
Players compete to be the first one to fill their playing board with the cards that make up a healthy meal.

Players take turns to draw food cards from the face down pile, a healthy food card that matches their board can be kept. A healthy food card that does not match must be put back face down.

However, a junk food card must be posted into the mouth of the gorilla, who gives a loud burp as each piece goes in.

27279.name: Animal Soundtracks
27279.description: Comes with 4 double sided game boards (9 pictures of animals on one side, 9 animal names on the other allowing non-readers to play against readers), some counters and a tape of animal sounds. Start the tape anywhere then put a counter on your game board whenever you recognise the call of one of your animals. First person to complete their board wins.

27280.name: Shootist
27280.description:
Shootist is a simple, quick-play, Wild West Shoot-Out game.

Extract from Overview of the game:

"Each player controls a gunslinger, or "Shootist", and takes part in an Old-fashioned, Movie-style, Western Shoot-out.

As few as two can play and although it can be played with any number it is particularly suited to groups of between five and ten players, each controlling one Shootist. A typical game should last an hour, although with very large numbers the game can take longer than this.

Players may also control groups of Shootists."

The game includes the miniatures rules, five scenarios and some Stand-up Counters to cut out.

27281.name: Focus: Uusi suuri tietopeli
27281.description:
Focus is a trivia game quite similar to Trivial Pursuit. It contains 400 cards with total of 2400 questions in six categories: miscellaneous, science and nature, entertainment, sports and leisure, geography and history.

Collect a token from each category to win.

27282.name: Presidentti-peli
27282.description: A Finnish game on presidential election. Players roll-and-move on a monopoly-like board, get professions and other sources of income, pay money for different reasons, and can become members of the parliament. The ultimate goal is to be elected the president, which happens through landing in the presidential election square, sponsoring a campaign, and then getting enough votes in a random draw of vote cards.

27283.name: Babble
27283.description: Babble is an electronic sound reversal game. The players take turns pushing the Record button to record a target word or phrase into the Babble game outside of earshot of the other players. Then the other players take turns attempting to guess the target phrase correctly. First they push the Play button which plays the target phrase backwards. They can do this a few time then they must push the Mimic button and attempt to speak the backwards phrase as close as they can. The Babble game then immediately speaks the mimicked phrase backwards which, if the player did a good job, should sound like the original target phrase. The player then guesses the target. If they are wrong the next player takes a turn. If they are correct the round is over and the next player records a new target phrase.

27284.name: Slide 'n' Ride
27284.description:
Movement based on color matching. players take turns rolling their ball shaped man down the slide into the pool to see which color the ball will stop on, then the player will transfer their ball onto their life preserver marker and move to the space on the board that matches that color. First person to the balloons wins.

box contains four balls and life preservers, slide pool with ladder, and game board.

from the box

2 skill building games help build these learning and social skills.

color matching
counting
taking turns
winning and losing

no reading required

27285.name: Scrapyard 500
27285.description:
(From the publisher's website)

Scrapyard 500 is a fast-paced road race game in which players "build" race buggies, load them with weapons and compete in a no-holds-barred race around the Scraptown track. Playable either with the counters included in the rules or with 28mm scale miniatures and 1/35 scale vehicles, Scrapyard 500 offers five character types to choose from in building a race team, six weapons (everything from net guns for the pacifists to flame throwers and rocket launchers for those of a more lethal persuasion) plus a hex-based, build-it-yourself track that includes nine different hazard hexes that can be used to make a different track for each race. Rules are easy to learn and offer endless chaos and laughs. Remember, it's not how you win the race. It's winning that counts.

27286.description: In this children's game for ages 3 to 6 players try to get their Sesame Street character across the game board to the park picking up friends along the way. The board is made up of four straight tracks each with 20 spaces. Players pick from 20 cardboard Sesame Street characters and insert them into the slot of one of the triangular pieces and put the piece on a Start space. The players take turns spinning the traffic light spinner which is equally divided into a 1, 2 and 3 area. The player then moves the number of spaces that was spun. When a players lands on a stoplight space they must stop there. When a player lands on a friendship space they get to pick a new Sesame Street character, insert it into one of the circular pieces and hook it to the back of their current character making a train. Play proceeds until a player makes it to the park space at the end of the track.
27286.name: Sesame Street Let's Go to the Park

27287.name: Time Blocks
27287.description:
From the Publisher:

Time blocks is a block stacking game that will surely challenge the whole family. It is fast paced and will summon your powers of shape and color recognition, not to mention building skills. Flip over a card, find the correct blocks and replicate the structure shown. But hurry... you only have a minute and some of the configurations are devilishly difficult to build. Younger children can play the game by duplication the pattern on the card flat on the table top. Game includes 28 hardwood colored blocks, 1 sand timer and a deck of 100 game cards."

Ages 7 to adult

Box has sticker on it stating "excellence in family issues - child's best toys - Child Magazine. (no year given)

27288.name: Trivial Pursuit: Pianeta Calcio
27288.description: An Italian expansion for Trivial Pursuit with 600 new questions about International and Italian football (soccer). Also playable without the game board, using the special dice included in the box.

27289.name: Sexta
27289.description:
3 possible moves:
- Move or insert 1 of your stones
- Move 1 part of the board.
- Rotate 1 part of the board

The starting formation for the board is a square and all 4 tiles had to be connected all the time (at least touching edge by edge). The goal of the game is to get 6 stones in a row.

27290.description:
Kar-a-a-ate Men is a unique, hard to find game from the mid 70's. Each player has a movable platform with a Karate champion action figure, roughly a foot tall, attached to the end. The platform has three control levers which allow you to left jab, right chop or right kick. Each figure has two pressure or impact points (one on the head and one on the chest). The object is to strike a blow to your opponent which triggers the pressure point and causes them to fall backwards.

The Karate champions both have a brown belt to begin with. If you win the match (first player to four points) you get to trade in your brown belt for a black belt.

The neat thing about the game is that it doesn't use batteries. It also has tightening screws on the bottom of the platform to ensure the spring like mechanisms work correctly.

The rules are quite simple, however, they also include penalties for cheating (ex. lifting the platform during the fight).
27290.name: KAR-A-A-ATE MEN

27291.name: AtmosFear: Khufu – The Mummy
27291.description:
Treasure, tricks or trouble - is this your lucky night?

Atmosfear: Khufu - The Mummy is an amplified experience in home entertainment. With its unique combination of board game and interactive DVD, this game of chance and skill is a race against time. Once you press play you only have 45 minutes to lay down all your scarabs then take on the Great Pharaoh himself in Khufu's ultimate challenge.

Race around the board to collect treasures, and face the challenges in each of the four Chambers of the Great Pyramid, where fortunes are won and lost at the roll of the dice.

With interactive game play, random selection that ensures a different game every time, and awesome atmospheric digital surround sound and picture, this speedy, spooky, spectacular DVD board game promises hours of fun and laughter for players 12 years and over.

So come on in and match wits with your host, the fiendish pharaoh Khufu. He really wants you to win!

Or does he...??

27292.name: Windkracht 10 spel
27292.description:
"Windkracht 10" was in 1997-98 a rather successful Belgian TV series on a "search and rescue" team located in the military base at Koksijde on the Belgian coast. This family boardgame was published in 2006 to accompany the launch of the unavoidable movie.

The game simulates the rescue missions. The board divides the Belgian coast and part of the sea in sectors. You have to respond to an SOS, pick up the survivors with one of the six helicopters and transport them to a nearby hospital corresponding with your playing color. The helicopters can be moved by all the players. Each player decides in secret how many spaces each chopper will move. You gain points for each successful delivery (the number of points depends on the mission). After a fixed amount of missions, the player with the most points wins. Event cards spice up the game.

The game contains 6 cardboard "3D" Seeking rescue-choppers.

27293.name: I.Q. Quiz
27293.description:
From the box:
"A fascinating quiz game"
"An "I.Q." game for family parties"

Contents are 12 Quiz cards of four types, each appearing three times. Each card has five puzzles (number sequence, missing-letters, pattern-recognition, anagram and general knowledge).

Probably this game is from the 1950s, though there is no date on the box or answer sheet.

The box is marked 'Series 3' and it seems there were several editions containing different puzzles. Certainly the replay value seems small for this on its own.

27294.name: Nothing but the Truth
27294.description:
From the box:
"Our latest travel game with a mirth provoking twist"

This is a kind of Treasure Hunt. The box contains twelve 'Teaser' cards and twelve 'Key' cards. The Key cards bear a list of words, and for each word there is a related trivia question that may be true or false, and a 'next' word that is to be found on one of the other Key cards. The Teaser cards bear a single unique printed word, each to be found on a different one of the Key cards, and space to write in eleven more. The Key cards are distributed around the playing area (maybe a room, a garden, or larger area) and the players travel between them, following their chain of words. Points are awarded for both speed of completion, and accuracy in answering the trivia questions.

The Teaser cards are in fact double-sided, with a different word on each side, allowing two rounds. The box states that additional Teaser cards can be bought, as replacements or to increase the number of players.

27295.description:
From the packaging:

Now it's easy to customize Fluxx!

All you need is a Fluxx deck, a permanent marker, and a little bit of imagination, and you can add your own favorite concepts and wacky game ideas to the card game with ever changing rules!

[Bonus! Chrononauts expansion card inside!]

Note: The current edition of Fluxx Blanxx has one of each type of card (including the Creeper but not the Ungoal) and it does not have the bonus Chrononauts card.

Part of the Fluxx series.
27295.name: Fluxx Blanxx

27296.name: Game of Life Fame Edition
27296.description: Discover your fate on the road to stardom! Like the original Game of Life Game, you start with Career or School Stage. Careers include TV Personality, Movie Director, Model, Pop Star, Film Star and Soap Star. Spin the wheel to see which career you belong to, whether you pay a large fortune or small fortune, how much space you move (including -2) and whether everyone moves forward or backwards... Be the highest earner at the end of the game to win!!!

27298.description:
Owner's Choice is an economic game in which the players must look to manipulate the stocks of four companies by trying to buy low and sell high. The players that own the most stock in a company assume the role of the President, with other players assuming the role of investors.

Owners have greater control over the fortunes of their companies' stock and they can make great profits but can also lose big as well. Importantly the Owner of a company can sell it for the market price at game end, whereas Investors can only make money by earning dividends, which are far less than the company price. As the game unfolds the players must decide how best to make money and potentially undermine some companies to reduce the fortunes of their competition.

The game's length is dictated by a pawn that moves around the board, which is a square similar to Monopoly. The players have some control over how many spaces the pawn can move in each turn, and the kind of space it lands on allows for a variety of things to happen.

Once the pawn reaches the Goal square it is time for Owners to sell their companies and Investors to cash in their stocks for dividends. The player with the most money wins the game.
27298.name: Owner's Choice
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 39 - Boardgame Podcast Awards plus Session Reviews with Colosseum and Owner's Choice

27299.name: Radio Star
27299.description:
A collection of three activities designed to test your musical knowledge.

Chart Toppers- Guess the decade that a song debuted.
Lyriculous-name a song using only the new lyrics provided.
Bubba-Lips-name a song by humming melody while putting a finger across lips rapidly.

Team Game, with 10 rounds.

boardgamehonor: 1999 Årets Spel Best Family Game Winner
27300.description:
Think of this game as Pachisi in 3D with a twist.

Each player has a set of pawns that start at the bottom of a six-sided pyramid. The dice control both pawn movement and pyramid twists.
You can only move pawns that are on your side of the pyramid, but you are encouraged to twist the pyramid to constantly change the playing field.
If your opponents pawns happen to find themselves in your part of the pyramid they can be moved down, blocked or even converted to your own color.
The winner is the first player to move half of his/her pawns to the top of the pyramid.
27300.name: Herre På Täppan

27301.name: Topper
27301.description:
"The object of the game is for each player to cover all the circular openings in his section with Topper pieces. EVERY PLAYER PLAYS ON EACH SPIN.
If the color black appears in the section of the player who has just turned the spinner, he can demand that one of the other players remove a Topper piece. from this section as a penalty."

27302.description:
From the box:

A Day Out with Thomas Game--A Matching & Memory Fun Game
Come along with Thomas on a train ride full of surprises! Climb aboard and let the fun begin! Get your Ticket “punched” as you visit the Station Stops on your Ticket, then race back to the Roundhouse. The first Engine to arrive at the Roundhouse with an empty Ticket wins the game! Game includes: game board, 24 station stop stars, 4 Day Out with Thomas Tickets, 6 magic cards, 6 animal cards, 8 story cards, 12 ice cream cards, 4 engine playing pieces and spinner. Ages 3+. 2-4 players.
27302.name: A Day Out with Thomas

27303.name: Over The Hedge Hedge Harvest Game
27303.description:
From the box:

Hammy and Stella are stocking up for winter by gathering all the food they can for hibernation. But suburbia is not always forest friendly -- there are scary sprinklers, SUVs and scouts to avoid. Players help them make their way "Over the Hedge" and around suburbia by collecting food tokens. The first friend to collect all seven food tokens wins the game! Contents: 1 Game Board, 1 Die, 4 Play Pieces: RJ, Verne, Stella & Hammy. 35 Suburbia Cards, 28 Food Tokens, & Instructions.

27304.name: Substitute Golf
27304.description: The game of SUBSTITUTE GOLF is comprised of 9 beautifully lithographed Boards (10"x22") representing the 9 holes of the indoor course. 7 disks representing Driver, Brassie, Cleek, Mid-Iron, Mashie, Niblick and Putter, 2 spinning blocks, 4 ball markers and Score Pads. Spinning those 7 disks give results as to the distance and direction that the ball has gone. Using the putter disk then decides if the putt has gone into the hole. The directions include ways for 8 or as many as 16 players to compete in a tournament with the winner getting some kind of prize that the host provides.

27305.name: Strategy Seven "The Board Game"
27305.description:
Strategy Seven is a new, single and multi-player "puzzle board game" that will put your logical deduction and memory skills to the test. With millions of variations, you will never have to play the same game twice!

Strategy Seven can be played as a single or multi-player game. It is a unique game that can be tailored to increase the level of difficulty to suit the player/s. Each game includes three Code discs ranging in difficulty from level 1 to level 3. There are additional "Collectors" Code discs available (from level 3 to level 7).

You can increase or decrease the difficulty of each game by choosing various ways of setting up the board. The markers can all be placed on the board with the colored sides facing up to play an easier game. For a more challenging game, the markers can be placed on the board with the numbered sides facing up.

The objective of the game is to re-arrange moving pieces, by rotating the center code disc, to enable you to move desired components to their correct locations.

Home Page: http://www.stencils.co.za/Strategy.htm

boardgamehonor: 2007 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
27306.description:
Nürnberg 2007 release for 2-5 players aged 10 and above. Contents: 86 swamp tiles, 42 buildings, 42 building cards, 20 treasure tiles, 5 gondolas, 4 builders, 1 board, 1 rules booklet.

The players use cards to construct buildings in Venice, which is one way of advancing their respective gondolas.
In addition, players collect treasure tiles if they place a building in a district adjacent to their gondola, and drain swamps to collect swamp tiles. Swamp and treasure tiles can also be used to advance a player's gondola. At the end of the game, the player whose gondola has moved the farthest, wins.

Online Play


BrettspielWelt (real-time)
27306.name: Venedig

27307.name: The Life of Paul
27307.description: Follow Paul on his three missionary Journeys. Test your knowledge and learn more about the Bible as you reinforce positive Christian values and provide lots of fun for all. Third in the Bible Journeys series. Ages 8 and up. Includes game board, playing pieces, and question cards.

27308.name: Abteilung: WW2 Battle Rules for 15mm Figures and Models
27308.description:
Extract from Design and Philosophy "War is Hell" section of the rules:

These rules are intended to cover actions of divisional size. In the main it is intended that players consider their forces to be of about 5 battalion strength.
These rules have been kept simple in mechanism in order to provide the players with an opportunity to explore tactics, scenarios and have some fun too. The player is in the position of overall commander. This means that the minutiae of detailed decisions are not always his concern (it would be bad generalship to keep checking subordinates for correct actions), thus the rules allow for unpredictable things to happen. These rules partition the figures and models into commands. A command represents a battalion sized formation.

27309.name: Breitenfeld
27309.description:
The game covers the 17th Century battle between the Swedes and the Imperials.

It was published in Panzerfaust Magazine Volume 5 #3 in July 1970.

Components:

Rules booklet
Map in four 8.5" X 11" sheets
Counters are on one unmounted sheet printed in three colors.

27310.description:
A skirmish wargame based around the close of the nineteenth century. The back drop is around Germany launching an invasion of France and Britain. A squad level game, where soldiers fight in desperate battles across urban landscapes in a bid to stem Germany and their powerful war machine. England Invaded comes with a rule book (24 pages) and 10 Figures. (3 German & 7 British)

Over the Wire used a unique system for developing fire power based on the levels of command you units are under. The better (higher Ranked) your command the more powerful the attack. The unit sizes are based on Squads of miniatures where each base is a Infantry/Command/Support Squad.
27310.name: England Invaded

27311.description:
Game published in 1897 by the Rhode Island Game Company.

The object of the game is to capture with the small discs or men the ships and territory of the opposing player.

The game board features spots for Admiral Dewey, Admiral Sampson, Admiral Cavery and Admiral Motijo and spaces for Torpedo, Short on Coal, Out of ammunition and Mines. The board is divided with each side in possession of half at the beginning. Object of the game is to take over all of the opposing men

The game board also features drawings of famous ships that actually took part in the War. American Cruisers; Vesurtux, Olympia & Brooklyn along with Battleships; Massachusetts, Oregon and Iowa.

Players have 10 men and a Flagman who move depending on a spin, but once a piece crosses into the other players territory that piece is moved either left or right depending on whether or not the roll was odd or even. When a man stops on a square marked Mine, Torpedo or Out of Ammunition in an enemy territory he must return to his side of the board.
27311.name: Uncle Sam at War with Spain

27312.name: Trade
27312.description:
TRADE is a game made by Artray of Montclair, NJ in 1933. The game comes with 4 puzzles of 16 pieces each. The puzzle pieces are shuffled together and then dealt out to the players. Each player then turns up picture side and assembles as many pieces as possible of each puzzle, the object being to complete the picture of which the player has the most pieces.

The player to the left then selects a piece from another player and trades one of his own for that piece. Each player in turn does that until one player completes a puzzle.

Score as follows; Each player other than the winner scores for each piece of the puzzle completed while the winner scores 25 points for completing the puzzle.

After a puzzle is done mix the pieces up again and begin a new hand. 50 or 100 points needed to win the game.

27313.name: Ration Board
27313.description:
A game created in 1943 in order to help Americans deal with the fact that rationing of goods was needed in order to win the war!

Players start at home and then travel along a much traveled route applying for Ration Cards at the Ration Board. Players are liable to meet many obstacles along the way. Luck and skill are important factors in players acquiring their ration cards. Numerous helpful as well as hindering elements that make the trip a most exciting experience can to a certain degree be determined by the players themselves but others are left to chance. As is natural during the present emergency, the players will take these encounters in stride like the good American he/she is.

Each time around the board the person stops at a different Ration Board and tries to acquire a different ration card by fulfilling different requirements; BUTTER roll a 5 or a DOUBLE, SUGAR roll an 8 or a 2 or a 12 etc. The first player to acquire 5 ration cards and return home is the winner.

The game board is a road winding through the countryside and suburbs to a city where the Ration Boards are stationed and then back again to home.

Additional info: Contained 8 wooden car pawns and 2 wooden dice, and was "item number 432" from Jayline Manufacturing Company of Philadelphia, PA.

27314.name: A Christmas Carol
27314.description: Simple board game with trivia added. Using Charles Dickens "A Christmas" as a backdrop, the game allows each player to take the role of one of eight characters from the book, like Scrooge, Tiny Tim, or Fezziwig. The game has players moving around the board collecting tokens. Half of the tokes are gained from reaching one of the buildings on the board, and the other half from answering trivia about "A Christmas Carol." Most questions are easy enough to answer if you've seen a few of the movies, some are more specific to the book. Once a player collects all the tokens, he returns to the center of the board for the win.

27315.name: Aiutino
27315.description: Party game where each player secretly selects 6 words among tens listed on the Argument card received at game start. Then at his own turn, the player starts to show just the first letter of each word. Other players secretly write down their guess, then the second letter is revealed, then third and fourths ones. Points are assigned depending on which round (1 to 4 letters revealed) you have written the right word.

27316.name: Il Cognome della rosa
27316.description:
Party game where each player select a famous phrase (among many listed proverbs, title of songs, books or movies) and applies to it 5 consecutive "transformations" as ordered by 5 cards received randomly at start. Goal of the game is to guess original phrases of other players and use your 5 transformations to make your own phrase as much difficult as possible.

Points are assigned depending on which level of "transformation" you eventually guess a phrase (1-5)

27317.name: Paragon's New Twentieth Century Skirmish Rules
27317.description:
A precis of the rule’s introduction.

These rules are intended for use with one infantry section (usually 10 men), in 54mm scale, per player, which attacks a small objective such as a machine gun bunker or defended house (Airfix Strongpoint). Start with the basic rules, and when you have mastered these add some or all of the more realistic advanced rules. You can use any scale, of course - half all distances for 25mm scale, and if you insist on fighting Stalingrad in a matchbox an the 10.30 from Paddington, divide distances by 10 and use 5mm figures! As is inevitable, this has escalated to whole platoons (often still with one player per section) with some support such as a medium machine gun team or man-pack flamethrower team per side. We've never bothered very much about a points system, though one is included in the appendices to these rules, except that men defending a strong position such as a farmhouse should be attacked by about twice their number. Favourite games include two units of 10 partisans each, ambushing a German staff car with escort of two motorcycle combinations and a section in a half track, and a British Recce unit consisting of a turret less Stuart tank, a Dingo scout car and a half-track with infantry section running into a German advanced defence unit in slit trenches with MMG's and Panzerfausts. The possibilities are enormous, and great variety can be achieved quite cheaply, using Britain’s or Airfix figures and vehicles, which are less prone to damage than Tamiya and other plastic models, though we use these too!

Each soldier must have the correct rank, weapons and equipment, a limited supply of ammunition (so that he can run out!) and is identified by a number on his base. This number ensures that each man stays with his correct unit - if he's more than 20cm. from it, he has deserted! Wounds are NOT bullet wounds - you don’t go anywhere with a bullet, in you, no matter WHAT John Wayne gets up to! Wounds restrict a man's fighting ability, and may eventually prevent him from fighting, though he may recover in time for a later round if you are fighting a campaign.

27318.name: Dead Walk Again
27318.description:
Dead walk Again, DwA, is a set of free, print-and play tabletop rules inspired by zombie movies that we all saw when we were younger. It is SWAT vs Zombies action in a fictional town called "Deadville." Over the last couple of years the designers have displayed the game at different game shows, and have found out what works and what doesn’t. From the designers: "After many game rule adjustments and countless hours of testing, we now feel that we have found the right balance in the game, and would like for you to experience it as well."

Microbadges
Buy It

Buy It

27319.name: Kack the King
27319.description:
This is a card game by Joe Magic Games. The game is played with two custom decks of playing cards with renaissance art depicting medieval England. Kingdoms are set up on mats that define each player's domain. Players attempt to manipulate the cards which represent different aspects of the court, including kings, queens, assassins, and spies. They also manage population, treasury, and war.
The game includes pawns that indicate level of royalty, and advancement cards like: Longbow, Sanitation, and Chivalry. Also, mixed in with the cards are events like Corruption, Peasant Revolt, and Black Death. The player who is the current ruler has the ability to tax and forbid other players to perform particular actions. In this way, that player has more control over events, but also is a bigger target for war and assassination.
The winner is the player who manages to survive two rounds by either having the only living population or being the ruler and only player with cards.

27320.name: Genghis Khan
27320.description:
Solo card game.
13th Century Asia: Take the role of Genghis Kahn:
Expand the Mongol Empire as far as you can in all directions.

The game ends at the end of 21 turns.
This represents the death of Genghis in 1227.

27321.name: The Alamo
27321.description:
Card game. Simulates the siege of the Alamo in 1836.

Players will have to make their own sets of cards.
The Texans and Mexicans have their own unique decks.

Instructions are included to be able to play solitaire.

27322.name: Monopoly: Chocolate
27322.description:
This is only Monopoly in name. The name and visual trademarks are licensed from Hasbro, but any similarity ends there.

The player whose turn it is spins a spinner. This determines where the player places a chocolate piece representing a property color. When all properties of that color or railroad have been placed, the next player to spin that color or railroad gets to eat all those chocolates.

There are 32 pieces of milk chocolate in the game. The winner is the player who accumulates and eats the most pieces of chocolate properties.

27323.name: Le Jeu de la Guerre
27323.description:
A game that attracted little attention when it was published in the eighties, despite the reputation of its designer. The concept was developed by French essayist Guy Debord (1931-1994) in 1965, but not published for many years. Debord described himself as a filmmaker, but he is known as the founder and one of the most important members of the Situationist International, a small band of avant-garde artists and revolutionaries. One key concept of their theory is the spectacle: the image replaces substance and modern capitalist society is a society of "spectacular" commodity consumption. Having long been treated as a producer, the worker is now courted and seduced as a consumer.

In 1977, Debord created a small publishing company named "Les Jeux Stratégiques et Historiques" with French movie producer Gérard Lebovici. The first game was Debord's "Le Jeu de la Guerre", but only 4 prototypes are produced. The game was published as a book, with a map, rules and detailed descriptions in 1987. (Lebovici had been mysteriously shot in a parking lot in Paris by this time). In 1991, Guy Debord decides to insist that all his movies & books be destroyed. It is also the fate of his book/game. Debord committed suicide in 1994. Nevertheless during the '90s, his work gains more and more influence. The book/game is published again in 2006 by French publisher Gallimard (price: 18 €), but it's only a book (in French), co-signed by Debord's lifetime partner Alice Becker-Ho.

The game uses a mapboard containing 500 squares (25 x 20) divided in two by a border line. Each territory has 2 arsenal squares, 3 fortress squares, and 9 mountain squares (blocking movement,shooting and communication lines). Setup of units (infantry, cavalry, artillery, horse artillery) is free and secret. At his turn, each player may move up to 5 units and/or attack. Aim of the game is to completely destroy the enemy or conquer his 2 arsenals. No dice: combats are resolved taking into account the attack/defense ratios of the opponents (unit retreats from -1, and is destroyed from -2) Communication lines are critical.

The English translation published by Atlas has a faulty translation of the rules, making it more or less unplayable.

27324.description:
Doubly licensed Full Thrust variant stand alone for the Traveller RPG's setting universe. Licensed by GZG and Far Future Enterprises.

Mechanics are adapted from and distinct from Full Thrust, specifically to capture the feel of small line vessel combats in the Traveller universe.

Includes the rules but not the ships from Power Projection: Escort, and expands them.

(The US edition published in 2006 by Ad Astra Games does include many, but not all, of the ships from Power Projection: Escort)

Update: All the Power Projection: Escort ships can be downloaded for free at http://www.powerprojection.net/

from the BITS page:
Power Projection: Fleet focuses on capital ships and campaign based combat. In addition to the secondary weapons seen in Power Projection: Escort, spinal mounts, black globes, fighter squadrons and planetary defenses are detailed. Larger engagements are supported with a dice based quick statistical resolution system for dice rolls. There is a scenario engine, which allows you create double blind missions (where neither side knows the other's objectives). There is a campaign system built around a melding of the Fifth Frontier War engine with Trillion Credit Squadron.There are 25 ship designs and 6 types of fighter squadron described covering both Imperial and Zhodani forces. Conversion rules are given to allow you to take any High Guard, MegaTraveller or Traveller T20 design and convert them to a Power Projection design. There are two pages of color starship counters, plus two black and white counter pages.

SBN 1-901228-32-0, 76 pages, A4 format, written by Dominic Mooney. Cover by Jesse DeGraff. © 2003.
27324.name: Power Projection: Fleet

27325.description:
Doubly licensed Full Thrust variant stand alone for the Traveller RPG's setting universe. Licensed by GZG and Far Future Enterprises.

Mechanics are adapted from and distinct from Full Thrust, specifically to capture the feel of small line vessel combats in the Traveller universe.

from the BITS page:
Power Projection: Escort focuses on the smaller, non-capital ships of the Traveller universe. These are the ships smaller than 10,000 tons with no spinal mounts. The game includes two sheets of black and white counters, 14 Zhodani and Imperial ship designs and a number of scenarios. It is full compatible with Power Projection: Fleet and has 12 ship designs which aren't included in that book.

ISBN 1-901228-31-2, 30 pages, A4 format, written by Dominic Mooney. Cover by Jesse DeGraff. © 2002.
27325.name: Power Projection: Escort

27326.name: Revelation
27326.description:
Revelation is a straight-forward trivia game that contains 5000 questions and answers about the Bible. It includes the following categories of questions: Events and Places, People, Things, Numbers, and Memory.

Contents: A Playing board, one die, eight colored tokens, forty-eight color coded discs, and a book of questions.

The winner is the person/group that first disposes of 6 color-coded discs by placing them on the corresponding color-coded symbols on the board; this occurs when the corresponding question is answered correctly.

27327.name: Get Rollin'!
27327.description: Get Rollin! is a dice rolling game. Each of the four players has an eight space track on the board, a playing piece and five six-sided dice. A large bell is placed in the center space of the board. The leader for a round rolls one die to determine the target number. Immediately after that all players begin rolling all of their dice as fast as possible. Any time a player rolls the target number they must place any dice with that number in the center of the board and call out how many dice along they are toward getting all five with the target number. They then continue to roll the rest of their dice. When a player gets all five of their dice to match, they ring the bell and win the round moving one space on their track.

27328.name: Brain-O-Matic
27328.description: Brain-O-Matic is a trivia game. Players answer questions to get to roll and move their piece along the board track. On most spaces they must press the button on the "brain". The brain makes sounds and cycles lights through the six categories until it settles on one. The player must answer a question from this category. There are three questions on each card for the three level of difficulty in the game. Children could play the easy level while adults could play from the two harder levels. The players race to get to the end of the track.

27329.name: The Game of Rival Doctors
27329.description:
Old Mr. Holmes of Homesville, a very rich man living about 20 miles from the Village of Spruceville, having taken suddenly ill sends his colored boy (I know that this is politically incorrect but the rules do in fact state that and for completeness I have included it) Tom to the village to summon a doctor. Several Doctors head for Homesville and the game is based on their journey.

Each player takes one piece to represent a doctor. Each player spins the indicator in turn and beginning at the Doctor's Office heads forward toward Homesville. The object is to arrive there by exact count. Along the way the Doctors will be affected by squares that they land on. "Doctor meets Mr Smith who hurt himself. Doctor and Mr.Smith must both go back to the office." or "Doctor finds he has lost his medicine and must return to the Eight Mile House to look for it" or "Doctor's horse runs away and Doctor must return to Mr. Jones' residence" or "Doctor's carriage breaks down and he must return to the Blacksmiths Shop for repairs". The Doctor who arrives at the Homesville site first by exact roll wins the game.

27330.name: French Start
27330.description:
Simple dice rolling mechanic, roll the dice, answer vocabulary question, if you get the answer right, continue moving. Depending on the space you land on, there are different categories of questions. If you get a right answer, you collect that category card, if you collect all six, get to the finish space to win.

Object of the game is to help teach French vocabulary, the words are fairly basic, so it is for someone just learning French.

27331.name: Dino Trivia
27331.description:
Dino Trivia is jam-packed with questions and quirks about dinosaurs! Amaze your friends when you know the answer to: "Where was the first Velociraptor fossil found?" If you are a junior player, do you know the answer to "What did a T-Rex eat?" When you cannot answer some questions correctly, you might be asked to perform an outrageous action and pretend you are an Allosaurus chasing your prey!!!

[Text from back of box]

Players take turns asking the person to their left questions from the back of the next card drawn from the pile. Standard questions may be quite difficult, even for an adult, while "junior" questions are very simple to accommodate younger players. A correct answer earns the player the card while an incorrect answer may require them to perform an "outrageous action," such as flapping their arms like a Pteranodon.

The winner is the first to construct a T-Rex skeleton composed of four separate images on the backs of the cards they earn. Obviously many cards contain duplicate images, so reaching this goal may require more than four correct answers.

All information is taken from the book Dinosaurs by Michael and Caroline Carroll; religious content is held to a minimum on the cards themselves (2 of 100 questions).

27332.name: Rolly Poker
27332.description:
A combination of standard Poker bidding and bluffing rules with a dexterity game. The box plastic inlay holds a tilted cardboard surface in which wooden pegs are placed - these serve as obstacles for a glass marble, which is flicked from one of four starting points to roll down the surface and land in one of five numbered target pockets.

One player tries to reach a certain score determined by cards - the other players may or may not believe that he will be successful.

The cards are printed in English and French - the cheap produced instruction sheet in the German edition leaves much of the game's rules obscured.

27333.name: Questival
27333.description:
Questival is a trivia boardgame published in the Philippines. Game components is composed of 2 dice, 1 hourglass, 8 plastic chips, play money, and a rule sheet.

Players are divided into two separate teams (Red and White) that must compete in answering questions from cards randomly drawn with the use of a dice. There is a plastic hourglass included in the game to set a time limit on how long each team can answer a question. Correctly answered questions allow that team to win play money and to have another turn. So there can be a chain of turns for a team until a question has not been answered correctly and the time runs out. The gameboard acts as a scoring track and for separating the question cards based on its points. The team which earned the highest score and grabbed the most in prize money is the winner.

27334.description:
Cirkle 4 is an Abstract strategy game. Four Armies based in the four corners of the board. Players can play on teams or as individuals. The object of the game is to capture an objective square or destroy an Army or a set of pieces. Players needs to write on a paper their secret winning target/ objective at the start of the play. Cirkle 4 is based on Cirkle 2 system/combat (see Cirkle 2) adapted to a 3 or 4 players situation.

Home Page: http://www.1-2-3-games.com/en/cirkle-games/cirkle-4
27334.name: Cirkle 4

27335.description:
The players are dealt eight cards. During this initial deal, one player is assigned the role of terrorist. There are twenty-four rounds of gameplay. Each round tells the players which suit must be played in order to win the trick. The Jack Bauer Card is wild and wins any trick. A player who wins a trick must either draw and keep two cards or draw and follow the instructions from the top card of the Action Deck.

The terrorist wins the game by not being eliminated and having the most points or by eliminating all the other players. Any other player can win by eliminating the terrorist or by having the most points.

The 24 Countdown Game is based upon the popular Fox TV show "24".

Buy Microbadge - 24 fan


Buy Microbadge - Kiefer Sutherland is a character Jack Bauer plays when he's not saving the world.
27335.name: 24 Countdown Game

27336.name: PowerShot Soccer
27336.description:
PowerShot Soccer is the exciting action-packed two-player soccer strategy card game that captures all the thrills and excitement of the real game. Easy to pick up, but impossible to put down, the object of the game is to score goals while your opponent tries to stop you from scoring. With PowerShot Soccer’s perfect mix of adrenalin-pumping action, skill and chance, the excitement never lets up. It’s the same soccer you love, but not as you know it.

Non-stop action, anytime, anyplace! Bring your favorite World Cup soccer teams to victory. There are 10 different teams in all, with each PowerShot Soccer deck reflecting the strengths and weaknesses of the actual teams. Brazil dazzles with their superb dribbling and powerful strike force; England scores with their pinpoint passes and sublime skills in crossing the ball; while Italy boasts a stellar defense with their strong interception abilities.

27337.name: Radio TMG: the music game
27337.description:
A music trivia game with 2 CDs and an electronic gizmo to record who buzzes in first. There are also action rounds (mime playing the drums or sing a Paul Simon song) as well as "improvised trivia" - category plus first letter e.g. name a "band" starting with "S".

From the back of the box:

This exciting game has heaps of music on 2 CD's and provides hours of fun with electronic buzzers that you hit when you recognize the songs or the artist. The disc jockey on the CD's will play music cuts from the 60's to the 90's, pop hits, rock and roll or themes from movies and TV shows. When you think you know the name of the song or who the artist is, hit your buzzer and the electronic umpire will decide who got in first. Even if your trivial knowledge is not up to scratch, playing an action card gives you a chance to gain points by putting on a mini-performance for your friends to enjoy. When using the TMG Quiz cards you create thousands of questions and hours of fun calling for fast action on the buzzers and another chance to be a superstar.

27338.name: Dawgs  ...and more dogs
27338.description:
54 cards: 40 dawgs, 8 set cards, 2 leashes, 2 bones, 2 dawg houses.
Each player is assigned a secret set of 5 dawgs they must collect. Players draw and discard until they make their set. The special cards add some spice to the game.

27339.description:
3 Man Chess is a unique chess variant for three players, played on a non-standard board such as a hexagon or circle with differently shaped cells to create an even playing field. The traditional rules about how pieces can move and capture other pieces still apply, but the addition of another player means that the goal and strategy is varied slightly.

The victory condition is different between versions, but the goal is usually to be the first player to checkmate another. In this case, the two remaining players both lose the game. This is designed to prevent two players from teaming up to defeat the third, and create a game of strategy rather than alliances.

This variant introduces new possible situations, such as when a piece could be captured by both of the other players and therefore neither player will risk their piece to take it. Strategy requires anticipating not only how your opponents will behave, but how their pieces will interact and affect each other. Many traditional opening moves are also ineffective in the three player variant.
27339.name: 3 Man Chess

27340.name: Dogopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
27340.description:
Monopoly with a couple of interesting twists. For kids, the most interesting twists are the canine theme. All the markers are dogs, the spaces around the board are different breeds, jail has become "the pound" and the houses are actually doghouses. Community Chest and Chance morph into Trees and Telephone poles (less sophomoric than it sounds) and instead of bank error in your favor you get rewarded for running off the dogcatcher or you have to go to the vet. The theme encourages a more light hearted approach than the serious real estate game.

For adults the best "twists" are those that speed up the action. The game does not require you to own all the territories of a given color before you can build a doghouse. You can only build as many doghouses as you have territories of that color, but you don't have to own them all. For instance, yellow in Dogopoly has three territories, if you own two of them you could have two doghouses on each, even if the third is unowned, or even owned by another player. Whenever you first buy a territory you are also given the option to immediately buy a doghouse at half-price. Taken together these little twists make the game go much faster.

There are few other twists, like the addition of shortcut paths across the board that can reroute players.

27341.name: Ringmaster
27341.description:
RINGMASTER - WAR FOR MIDDLE EARTH (2-6 players)

The game recreates the strategic battles between the good and evil armies of Middle Earth. The battle mechanism is based on the play of special cards. No dice are used. The game is divided into 3 levels: Basic, Advanced and Team.

BASIC LEVEL
In order to carry out a battle, the attacker calculates his Combat Value, equal to the number of his armies involved in the battle. This value can be modified playing one or more special cards divided into Magic Cards, Troop Cards or Ordnance Cards.
After this, the defender calculates his Combat Value, adding the value of his own armies and cards. The higher score wins the battle and inflicts casualties on the adversary; the difference between the two values (as an example, the black army has a Combat Value of 12 and attacks the green army with a Combat Value of 9). The difference, indicates that 3 green armies are destroyed.
In case of the same Combat Value, a Duel with the special symbols printed on the cards is carried out.
The use of the Magic Cards render unforeseeable consequences to the game. The winner is the first to gain 10 Victory Points, obtainable by conquering the territories of the opposing players.

ADVANCED LEVEL
In the Advanced Level, the players divide themselves into two factions (Alliance or Darkness Forces), trying to advantage or stop the travel of the Fellowship to Mount Doom, using another set of special cards with the major character of the Lord of the Rings (Nazgul, Allies, Tom Bombadil, Shelob, and so on).
The movement of the Fellowship on the map is guided by the good players, while the Darkness forces will try to hinder it. It is also possible for players to recruit the characters of the Fellowship, Nazguls, heroes or evil creatures using them in the battles (i.e. it is possible to recruit Gandalf in the good armies, fighting versus Shelob!).

TEAM LEVEL
Allied players conduct battles as a team. Armies setup is predetermined.

---
Many thanks to: ROIG YVES for the english translation (version 10.0), SEAN FORRESTER (version 9.0) and ANTONIO CHAVEZ (version 5.0)!

---
BEST PLAYTESTERS
Fabio Carta & Corrado Baggioni

---
HOW TO PLAY
RINGMASTER is a FREE game in pdf high-resolution. Print front/back the following 4 files. You need also some wooden cubes (or the Risk pawns) for the armies.

- Map (84x60 cm).
- Rules (14 pages)
- Battle Cards (64 cards)
- Event Cards (64 cards)

enjoy!

27342.name: Flight Deck
27342.description:
This children's game consisted of a plastic replica aircraft carrier deck and a movable joystick attached to a nylon filament pulley system which would be connected to an item of furniture. A model F4 Phantom jet was able to make landings on the mock-up carrier deck.

An arrestor hook on the undercarriage of the jet would catch a nylon trip wire on the replica flight deck during a landing, stopping the plane and raising a trap door on the deck, indicating a point scored for a successful landing.

Flight Deck was played in competition between two players, but was also suitable for solo play.

Airfix released an improved version - Outside the Scope of BGG - in 1975, featuring a catapult launch system and improved mechanics -

27343.description:
Mundialito (Gold Cup) is an abstract strategy board game of movement and ball control whose objective is for you to score a goal (getting your ball to the last row) before your opponent. Move your pieces, push and jump over your opponent's pieces until you score a goal.

Ages: 7 and up, a game for children and adults.

Available:

http://www.labsk.net/index.php?topic=4157.0
http://icehouse.labsk.net
http://icehousegames.org/wiki/?title=Mundialito

This game is one of the finalists of the 2007 Concurs Ciutat de Granollers de creació de jocs.
27343.name: Mundialito (Gold Cup)

27344.name: Deuda Eterna
27344.description:
eternal debt(deuda eterna)
a business trading Argentinian board game focused on the South American " real-economy situation "..use the commodities produced in Latin-America --> stock them and try to get in to the North American market..

your cash is a loan from the FMI (international mon. fund)
..I guess the interest rate has to be quite high :-)

27345.name: Operation Fitness
27345.description:
This game was produced by Waddingtons Games for SKI (a British yogurt manufacturer) and was available by mail order from SKI.

The object of the game is to be the first team coach to get all four members of their team 'fit' by reaching 100 points on the SKI fitness scale. There are no dice; instead pieces are moved round the board according to the instructions of red movement cards. They gain or lose fitness depending on the blue activity cards drawn. Fitness is recorded on dials (SKI Fitness Scales).

27346.name: Up Against Time
27346.description:
A steel ball is set moving down a ramp towards the base, on which a tower of barrels must be built.
