Each barrel has a protruding shape on top and a different indented shape on the bottom, to allow some combinations of barrels to interlock. Players must find the correct barrels as quickly as possible and stack as many as they can before the ball arrives. When they have completed as much of the tower as they are able, they shut a gate to stop the ball from reaching the barrels. If they are too slow, the whole tower will fall over when hit by the ball. Players take it in turns to see how high a tower they can build.

Players may use one hand only to stack the barrels. Points are awarded for barrels left standing after shutting the gate and a game comprises three rounds.

The game is called 'Up Against Time!' on the box and 'Up! Against Time' in the rules and on the game itself.

Similar to:

Wallamoppi

27347.description: Game published in Casus Belli n°68 and 69 covering Caesar's campaign in Gauls.
27347.name: Bellum Gallicum

27349.name: Grand Prix
27349.description:
Vintage Formula 1 racing game from the '70s.
Roll and move with no choices. Each player rolls the dice and moves their car around the track. Events occur when players land on specific spaces. Usually miss a turn or go slow.
First over the line after the chosen number of laps wins.

27350.description:
Kalevite Maa ("Land of Kalevs" in translation) is not sophisticated game yet it provides entertainment for parents and children alike. The object of the game is to be the first player to collect three items depicted on a secret quest card. The items - tokens with a picture of an item - are randomly distributed on the game board face down. Players take turns by moving their pawns on the board by one step. If the move ends on an unexplored token the player will claim the token unless the token is a monster in which case the monster has to be defeated first by rolling dice. Some items - sweets, to be precise - boost a player's speed or combat ability.

Kalevite Maa is a promotional boardgame. It is published by a sweets producer - "AS KALEV" - and 3/4 of the relatively large boardgame box is actually filled with sweets. Yet, it is an interesting and engaging game with components of outstanding quality.
27350.name: Kalevite Maa

27351.name: Operaatio Panda
27351.description:
Operaatio Panda is a game in which you take part in saving endangered species throughout the different parts of the world.

The players' objective is to find and then deliver these animals back to their native habitat from the hands of the poachers (people who hunt these animals and sell them to live in unnatural places). You can also find poachers throughout the game and deliver them to be punished.

All good actions earns you a diploma; the winner being decided by how many of these you've collected during the game. You can also earn or lose these by drawing from the "action" deck, in which you have different features; for example a one-way ticket to any location on the board.

The game is played by rolling the dice, then moving around the board in search of the rare species. And trying to avoid letting other players take advantage of your situations.

27352.description:
The game covers the first disaster that befell U.S. cavalry when they tried to coerce the Indian tribes on Bozeman trail.

This would culminate in the Fetterman massacre which the Indians lured 80 U.S. cavalryman into a huge ambush consisting of 1000 Indian warriors.

Basically surrounded and overwhelmed U.S. troops with heavy firepower(Spencer and Martini henry repeating rifles and Sprinfield muzzle loaders) and limited ammo vs. hordes of Indians armed mostly with bow and arrow but also a smattering of repeating rifles and muzzle loaders.

Chit pull game system based on his design Into a Bear Trap.

One 11x17" color game map
Over 280 playing pieces
One Rulebook
Playing Aid Cards
27352.name: Crazy Horse Black Shield White Bull: Prelude to Little Big Horn 1866

27353.name: Steeple chase
27353.description: Part of the Vintage Game Series, a series of very simple games inspired by games from the end of the 1800s. The game includes two pegs, a dice and a tin box with rules and steeplechase platform.

27354.name: Remember
27354.description: Remember is a very simple Concentration type game using Slot Machine type symbols like Cherries, and Lemons and Bells. He/She who matches most WINS!

27355.name: St. Petersburg Express
27355.description:
Business spirited railroad game for 2 to 4 players or teams. During play, players travel from location to location to make deals and deliver goods. Most movement happens in southeast Finland between Helsinki and St. Petersburg in Russia.

Heavy dice-fest during business actions and low player interaction in game. Account management and risk evaluation during business trades.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Årets Spel Best Family Game Winner
2007 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
2007 Vuoden Peli Adult Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Boardgames Australia Awards Best International Game Nominee
27356.description:
London, 1901. At the world famous Portobello Market, the goal in the morning is to secure the best places to build stalls. Try to place your stalls in the most lucrative manner, cut off your opponents, and grab the most profitable alleys for yourself. You can build only where the Bobby stands—but a little cash will make the Bobby stand where you want him to!

East India Railway was the prototype title for this game, and it became Portobello Market when published by Schmidt.
boardgameversion: Schmidt Spiele multilingual edition with award logos
27356.name: Portobello Market

27357.name: Time Travel
27357.description:
This is a simple historical card game, which contains 56 cards from different historical eras - Tudors, Viking, Romans, Victorians etc. These cards also have different objects such as coins, head wear, weapons, transport.

There are two games in the instructions.

The first is similar to Mau Maus but without the penalty points - you have to follow suits or objects. There are 4 "joker" cards to help the flow. The first to get rid of their cards is the winner.

The second game is a variant of rummy. You have to make 2 sets - one of four cards, and one of 3 and they can be either objects or eras.

There is a strong history theme and children pick up historical information as they play.

27358.name: The Wedding Planner Game
27358.description:
The Game of Life reworked into a party game for brides-to-be.

Players select and buy various wedding items (rings, cake, honeymoon package), while recording happiness points resulting from events leading up to the big day.

27359.description:
Aeronautic Imperialis


In the Dark Future of the 41st millenium Mankind must fight for survival in a hostile galaxy full of dangerous alien threats. The galaxy spanning Imperium of Man is the greatest empire in human history, but it must battle for its very existence. Wars rage across every planet in the Imperium, by land and now - in the skies, as the Imperial Navy, the Aeronautica Imperialis, Join the battle for mankinds survival.


Aeronautic Imperialis is a tabletop wargame for two or more players where you command the aircraft of the Imperial Navy or one of its many alien enemies. This book provides you with all the rules you need to play, and guides you through collecting and painting your own squadrons of Forge World miniatures.

Expanded by:

Tactica Aeronautica
27359.name: Aeronautica Imperialis

27360.description:
The blue color of your cape leaves an azure streak across the city skyline as you fly above the buildings on patrol. It has been a peaceful night over all, only one bank robbery, and that you stopped with the help of Kid Zip. The explosion rolling out of the building below you then breaks the silence. You watch with your super eyesight as the green color smoke rolls out of the window of one of Sonic Lab’s windows. You watch as Doctor Death leaps into the air from that very window, a beaker of the hyper explosive, chemical Y, tightly held in his armed fist. You thought he was still in jail, serving a 300-year sentence for his last attempt at destroying the city. With a sigh you dive into the coming fight, sure it will be another long night ahead. Who said being a super hero was all capes and fun.

Comic Book Heroes is a multi player card game where you take on the role of either a super powered hero or one of their many villainous foes. Streaking through the skies in your hyper jet boots, or crash through brink walls with your super strong muscles. All the thrills, excitement and goofy fun of classic comics are here within Comic Book Heroes. Struggle with and aid other players as they battle each other to see who will be the hero supreme.

So let the cosmic beams fuel your dreams of glory, the mutant genes turn you into a freak with a heart of gold or allow sinister plots to fill you with a destiny for glory and dominance of all mankind. Play Comic Book Heroes and live the adventure.

Each set comes with two characters, a hero and a villain with 18 cards for each. The set also comes with 18 common cards and 18 new common cards only available with that set, for a total of 72 cards per set.
27360.name: Comic Book Heroes

27361.name: Garments Galore
27361.description:
The box contains 12 cards, each with a list of words which are all types of garment, and a short story which has certain words omitted. The players must use the word list (or homonyms) to fill in the blanks, each word in the list being used exactly once. The winner is the player who correctly completes the task first.

"Game no. 94"

27362.name: Photo Crime
27362.description:
From the Box:
"The Crime Club Party Game"
"Test Your Power of Observation"
"Photographic Clues - for the solution of each problem"

12 cards are included, three copies of four types. Each card bears a photograph of a crime scene and a description of Inspector Cameron interviewing a suspect. Something in the picture reveals the suspect to be lying, and this is for the player (or team) to find.

Probably this game is from the 1950s, though there is no date on the box or answer sheet.

The box is marked 'Series 3' and it seems there were at least this number of editions containing different puzzles.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Foreign Game for Beginners Nominee
2007 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
27363.description:
The active player each turn draws cards from the deck equal to the number of players but does not look at these cards. He then turns one card face-up and gives it to one of the players, including himself; he repeats this process until each player has received exactly one card.

Each card includes a number from 0 to 5—the lower the better—and might also have an action or victory points! Each time a player receives a card, he checks to see whether his total equals 13 or more. If it does, each other player receives VPs from his own cards. The unlucky player with the total of 13 or more discards all his cards.

Possible actions on the cards include veto cards (in order to say no to a card in the future), 13 --> 18 (raising your bust total to 18), lose your last card, and receive 1 or 2 VPs immediately.

The German title of the game translates into English as 'That takes the biscuit'.
27363.name: Danger 13

boardgamehonor: 2007 Fairplay À la carte Winner
2007 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2007 Golden Geek Best Card Game Winner
2007 Golden Geek Best Gamer's Board Game Nominee
2007 Tric Trac Nominee
2008 JoTa Best Card Game Nominee
27364.description:
The general theme and mechanics of Caylus Magna Carta are similar to the Caylus board game. However, there is no board or score track and the tactical nuts and bolts of the game are somewhat different. In terms of components, the game consists of cards, money, worker pawns, resource markers, the provost, and castle building stones. Each player has a set of identical cards, which are shuffled and used as a face-down draw deck. Players start with an opening random draw of cards, and on his turn a player can either:


extend the road by building a new building
pay 1 to draw a new building card
pay 1 to discard his hand and draw a fresh hand (with the discard deck being shuffled for a new draw deck once the draw deck is exhausted)
pay 1 to place a worker on one of the existing building cards
build one of the common prestige building cards (some of which are placed at the beginning of the game as part of the setup) or
pass


Once everyone has passed, the cards are resolved up to the provost (which can be moved in passing order by paying money).

Ownership of the non-common buildings is shown by the card color. When a worker is placed on a card, the owner earns either resources or money as a reward instead of victory points. Players may also choose to help build the castle. Starting with the first player to have passed, players can pay resources to obtain castle stones. The stones are worth three different values (2-4 points). Players collect the most valuable ones first. In addition, the player who collects the most building stones each round is rewarded with a gold resource marker.

From round to round, 1st player privileges rotate to the left, and the provost starts two cards further down the path from the castle.

The winner of the game is the player who has accumulated the most victory points once the game end has been triggered the turn the castle is finished. Victory points are awarded for castle stones, cards built, and resources and money in hand at the end of the game.
boardgameversion: English first edition with Library Expansion
German edition with Fairplay "best card game 2007" logo
27364.name: Caylus Magna Carta
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGTG 103 - SR & Feedback (Pandemic On the Brink, Caylus Magna Carta, Patrician)
Episode 21 – Huch & Friends / Ystari Games – Neuheiten Frühjahr 2007
보톡스(Boardgame Talks) 제27회 - Francis Tresham, Caylus Magna Carta, Cavum, Vabanque

27365.name: Palatin
27365.description: Palatin - a hot game for vigilant observers, at least this is what the box says about the game. Basically it's roll and move to get your pieces through the "labyrinth" first. Also contains rules for team play.

27366.name: Politics by Other Means
27366.description:
A free Engle Matrix Game posted on the Hamster Press website. The publisher's description:

"Welcome to the honorable society of war gamers. Our hobby has a long and noble past. Ever since Robert Lewis Stevenson (Treasure Island) and HG Wells (War of the Worlds) played games with toy soldiers in the 1890's, grown men have been reliving make believe glory in made up wars."

"'Politics by other means...' is a simple war game suitable for children and adults. It is not tied to one historical period. It covers all wars from Summeria to Star Wars. All you need to play are a few figures, some six-sided dice and a table of toy terrain to make a battle field. The game is played by each player, one at a time, moving and shooting. Everyone going ends the turn."

27367.description:
From the publisher:

Down with the Empire is a game that uses a common theme of science-fiction sagas: A Stellar Empire that has gone rotten, and a rebellion that rises to bring it down. It is primarily a two-player game, although it is possible to have more than one player per side by dividing forces or tasks. The game can also be played solitaire. The game system is inspired in the old Freedom in the Galaxy game from SPI.

There are two major factions in the game, each controlled by a player. The Stellar Empire owns everything at start, and strives to maintain the status quo through its military might. The Rebel Concordance player owns nothing but a few characters and spaceships at start, but by causing unrest and rebellion throughout the Empire, he hopes to get resources that will allow him or her eventually to meet the Empire on equal terms.

The game presents you with action at very different scopes. First, you have to administer 50+ planets on a grand-strategic scale, with social, economic and political aspects that are tightly intertwined and can be handled in very different styles.

Then you will be in charge of large military units; starfleets formed by individual starships ranging from tiny fighters to mammoth battlestars, and ground units (legions, brigades and divisions) to slug it out on planet surfaces. War in space is a very complex affair, since you can't establish battle lines or prevent the enemy from hyperjumping to any location on the map… He who defends everything defends nothing, goes the maxim, and quick response is the key to victory.

Finally, the heart and soul of DWTE are the individual characters. As in all great space adventures, the huge starships may bumble about, but they do not determine the fate of the rebellion saga as much as the astounding contributions of a handful of heroes. The characters perform missions through which they hope to sway the people to join and support their cause, undermine the plans of the enemy and further their own side's goals. During the missions characters face all sorts of dangers, including firefights with lasers blazing against enemy soldiers or monsters, cantina brawls with unruly civilians, getting lost in wormholes, or such everyday occurrences as meteorites falling on your head!

Key Points:
A grand-scale science-fiction strategy game, which at the same time has a very detailed combat system with individual spaceships and ground military units, and a role-playing aspect with individual characters performing heroic deeds.

The wide variety of events in the game and the ramifications derived from players' choices and styles of play ensure that no two games will play alike.

It is a large game with a moderately high level of complexity, but once the rules are learned the game itself flows easily and the on-map counter density is not high.

Component List:
Full-color Stellar map
Full-color Rebel and Imperial Starfleet Displays
Over 1,400 counters
Over 200 Character, Item and Stellar Event cards
4 sheets of Charts and Tables
Campaign Scenario
108 page Rules manual
20-, 10- and 6-sided dice (not provided) are necessary for the PDF version of the game

Target Audience:
DWTE appeals especially to SF-buffs with an interest in space adventures and sagas, although its fascinating game system will be interesting and challenging for any gamer. The rules are written in a clear language with extensive explanations and examples of play. They have a logical, easily-referenced order and should not present any special difficulty even for inexperienced players.

Game Formats:
Virtual Tabletop
PDF Download

What is a Virtual Tabletop Game?
Our line of Virtual Tabletop games are powered by the Vassal Engine.
27367.name: Down with the Empire

27368.name: Living Landscapes
27368.description:
1/15/2007: The Living Earth Games website appears live, and Living Landscapes is available directly from the publisher as well as from a specific retailer in the UK: http://www.eco-logicbooks.com/index.cfm?fa=book_details&;book_id=995

Previously:

Living Earth Games is a now defunct game company that made ecologically aware games printed in 100% recycled materials. The company appears to have been on the web until 2004. The following information was on their website concerning Living Landscapes.

Living landscapes introduces in a playful way into the sometimes abstract relationships between the human needs and what you find in a rural landscape. Color frames around some card images distinguish the red human needs cards (food, shelter, climate regulation…) and the green cards that distinguish important landscape elements from the rest of the set. Laying down families of 3 or more cards (we give lists of examples), the players build up the design of a landscape and they can exchange cards between families.The game ends with a set of card families laid down as a draft landscape design.

27369.name: Youri's Pea
27369.description:
Living Earth Games is a now defunct game company that made ecologically aware games printed in 100% recycled materials. The company appears to have been on the web until 2004. The following information was on their website concerning Living Landscapes.

At each stage of their growth, plants like to have good soil, good air, the right water, and sun to thrive. In seven stages of the life cycle of this pea plant, the players bring together these four elements for steady growth, laying pieces in the outer puzzle when rolling the special figure die. Meanwhile, the wildlife in and around the garden can be a help or a threat: does the beetle eat the snail, sparing the pea plant; does the dove find enough grains or eat the peas?

Makes plant demands and growth easily understandable for toddlers and bigger children. Also for teens and adults in teaching situations.

27370.name: It's Raining
27370.description:
Living Earth Games is a now defunct game company that made ecologically aware games printed in 100% recycled materials. The company appears to have been on the web until 2004. The following information was on their website concerning Living Landscapes.

A game exploring the Water Cycle; each player represents a water droplet making it's way over the landscape, to the sea and into the air, interacting with the environment as it does so.

27371.name: Star Trek Game
27371.description:
Action and adventure in outer space! Be the first player to complete your Star Trek mission and return the U.S.S. Enterprise to the starting space!

Players choose one of four pathways through the game, themed to four Star Trek characters (Capt. James Kirk, Mr. Spock, Uhura and "Bones" McCoy) -- they must make it all the way to the end of the track and then back to their start space to win the game. There are two spinners, one for Warp speed and one for Impulse engines.

27372.name: Bonaparte
27372.description:
Epic strategy for 2-6 players. Players are controlling European empires. The goal of the game is too collect history point.

The box contains:
board (90x60cm)
54 action cards
6 empire cards
378 counters
money
rule book

27373.name: Guillotine
27373.description:
This is game about the French Revolution.

Every player leads one of the 4 Groups of the "Konvent", the Parliament of this time.

The game works in rounds. In every round the players send their 6 Group-Members to different places on the gameboard where they either earn recognition or can vote about what happens to other members.

For example there is a "Revolution-Tribunal". The members there (max. 4) vote on other members who are accused. A negative vote can bring the accused Group-Member a visit to the guillotine!

There are other places with different functions and every player can negotiate an agreement with others. But...no one has to do, what he promised during those negotiations. Treachery everywhere (at the right time of course!) is a main thing in this game.

The winner is the player who holds the most living group-members after a maximum of 10 rounds.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
27374.name: Europareise
27374.description:
Description with permission from www.boardgamenews.com-

"By airplane to Paris? By ship to Barcelona? Or by car or train to Milan? No matter how you do it, travel throughout Europe! With a good plan, the correct tickets, and some luck in your luggage, you'll lead a travel party to multiple destinations and use insider tips to make side trips. A slew of information in words and pictures for 155 cities is awaiting your visit!

The players travel by car, train, ship and airplane from city to city and control private and public destinations with three travel companies. The goal is to visit as many destinations as possible in six differently colored regions. Whenever a player reaches a destination, he lays the corresponding city card in front of himself. The game ends when a player has at least ten city cards (or nine cards with five or six players) in six different colors before himself, although the round is played to its end. The winner is the player who visited the most destinations in all six colored regions.

New game mechanisms: Europareise possesses novel game mechanisms that differ from the familiar travel games in the Ravensburger catalog (Deutschlandreise, Weltreise). Movement doesn't come from dice, but rather from tickets for planes, ships, trains, and cars. To keep the lines from tangling on the gameboard, no flight lines or ship lines are marked on the gameboard. The players travel from a ship's harbor with a ship chain to any harbor within reach of the ship chain. Travel by airplane is done similarly."

27375.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple strategic game of the conflict between Japan and America in World War II. The area mapsheet portrays an area of the Pacific from New Guinea to Kyushu. The players control land, sea, and air forces. Each unit is rated for attack, defense, and movement.
27375.name: Pacific Storm

27376.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

Up to six cars compete in a six lap race around an irregular oval track. Each car/driver counter is rated for speed, acceleration, and turning. The game focuses on making a successful die roll for each space through the corners. The cars may pass at will.
27376.name: To the Races!

27377.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple, abstract game of spaceship commerce and conflict. Up to two players compete to amass 50 billion credits by the end of the game. The players move pirate, merchant, and bounty hunter ships through various sectors of space. A third player may control the police force ships, which attempt to destroy all pirates.
27377.name: Space Merchants

27378.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple, abstract game portraying a ground attack campaign by F-18 Hornets. "Goal: Defeat Somalian forces in a quick strike campaign. You play the 101st tactical ground attack. This unit is assigned to the USS Nimitz. While F-14's/EA-6's and other aircraft fly missions, you are assigned to take out ground targets around Somalia."
27378.name: With the 101st Tactical Ground Attack

27380.description:
Description with permission from www.boardgamenews.com-

"Europe, about 400 CE. Harsh customs rule the day. Five courageous tribes have set out to conquer new lands: the Huns, the Langobardens, the Goths, the Anglo Saxons, and the Vandals. As you seek new settlement areas for your tribe, you'll strengthen it by enlarging clans, establishing or conquering new countries, and building a powerful sea presence. Whoever scores the most points will stand far ahead of others on the tribe leader path and win the game.

Origo is a family game for 2-5 players from ages 10 and up, in which luck and tactics are mixed well. Depending on the number of players, the game duration is 30-90 minutes.

The flow of the game is driven by cards on the one hand (expanding, attacking) and by the movement of figures on the boards on the other (hiking, sailing). The player whose turn it is carries out the following actions in any sequence: expanding, attacking, hiking, sailing. Whoever occupies the final field in a country founds that country and receives points. There are further points in three large tribe evaluations during the game for the largest tribes, control of the seas, and control of the countries.
Contents: gameboard, scoreboard, 5 tribe leaders, 188 tribe shields (in five colors), 12 foundation stones, 1 action stone, 2 short rule sets, instructions."

The game is, in many aspects, very similar to Captain Future

Home Page: http://kramer-spiele.privat.t-online.de/neuerscheinungen/ori... (German)
27380.name: Origo

27382.name: Aufgepaßt im Verkehr!
27382.description:
Road safety educational game.

One of 16 cards is drawn - with typical traffic situations seen from a bike-riding kid's perspective, but with empty roads (no other vehicles or traffic signs, depending on the type of card),
then a small cut-out car or a policeman or a traffic sign or -light is placed onto the card, thus creating a typical situation where the question for the kid is: May I ride further or do I have to stop?

All players then secretly deploy a white (go) or black (stop) chip. The chips are revealed, then every player explains his choice. Finally the back of the card is revealed to learn which answer is right (the cut-outs are coded to easily find the correct solution). Correct answers win a yellow chip. The player with the most chips receives a cardboard biker medal.

As ten different vehicles (e.g. with different turn signals)/ten traffic signs can be placed on each card the game contains a sum of 160 different situations.

27383.name: New World Disorder
27383.description:
FIRST EDITION

Gangs of urban warriors battle each other, corporate mercenaries, mob hit-men, cannibals, and who-knows-what-else in this game of the fight for survival on the streets of the very near, very dystopian future.

New World Disorder has all the rules you'll need to play out character-driven scenarios in a world gone wrong, including: character creation and advancement, an extensive list of modern and near-future weapons and gear, several ready-to-play scenarios, and much more. Also contained in this 57-page document are 3 pages of character rosters, tokens, and templates.

Survival is no game, especially on the mean streets of the near future.

27384.name: Strippopoly
27384.description:
Strippopoly is a game that will add excitement, romance, and mystery to your life. You can play it with a group of friends, with your “ significant other ”, or both at the same time if you prefer. Whoever you choose to play with, you will get to know them much better and in more interesting ways before the game is over
2 games 3 levels soft core, hard core, & Extreme. You pick the level you'd like to play!
Soft core :A lot of stripping & putting on your clothing. Non-sexual with non-partner, touching partner
Hard core :A lot of stripping & putting on your clothing. Hands, sexual touching, partner and non-partner
Extreme :A lot of stripping & putting on your clothing. LOOK OUT!!! Anything goes!
2 games alcohol & non-alcohol

boardgamehonor: 2007 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Familien Recommended
2007 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
27385.description:
It's a contest of cubes and numbers! Define a recipe of 1-5 cubes and you're awarded 2 cubes (according to the square where you define it) and you're awarded 1-10 VP (according to your choice of the numbers 1-10 that remain). Henceforth anyone who duplicates that recipe gets the same 2 cubes and the same VP while paying you 1 cube from your recipe -- but you can never duplicate your own recipe. Except for the 1 cube paid to the originator of the recipe, cubes used making recipes are out of the game, and the game ends when there are only two colors left in the general supply.

That's the basic scramble for points, plus an end-game bonus for the player who had the most success getting his secret cube color out of the game.

Online Play


Yucata (turn-based)
27385.name: Alchemist
boardgameexpansion: Alchemist: All for One, Two for All
Mayfair Games Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #5

27386.name: Passion Throw
27386.description: Passion throw is a sex game for two consenting adults. It uses a sheet with spaces printed on it. Each space has a foreplay command to follow. Players take turns tossing the foam die and moving their playing piece (a satin pillow) around the board. The player who reaches the last space on the board chooses the first lovemaking position for the two to engage in.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Foreign Game for Beginners Nominee
27387.description:
From the Amigo website:
Play a card and draw a card—it's that simple. Whoever has at most five points in her hand can call "Bungee" and has...almost won. In the end, though, the winner is the player with the fewest points.
27387.name: Bungee

boardgamehonor: 2007 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Childgame Nominee
27388.description:
From the Amigo website:

Faster and ever faster, the rabbits hop over diverse items and cover them. And they must pay attention not only to what's ahead, but to where they are now. So eyes up and spoons high because even with long ears, only practice makes one a Master Hare!

From the Playroom Entertainment catalog:

Time to get your memory moving with Hop to It! Take a deep breath, get a good look at the row of objects, and then you're off! As soon as you remember an item that's covered, the cover is removed and placed on the next item in the line. With only 30 seconds to remember all of the objects, you'll need to be quicker than a bunny as you hop from one item to the next.
27388.name: Hop to It!

boardgamehonor: 2006 Australian Games Association Game of the Year
2010 Årets Brætspil Winner
27389.description:
Smart Ass the board game is the ultimate fun trivia game for 2 to 12 players, where everybody plays every turn, the game doesn't labor on for hours, and even if you are a "Dumb Ass", you can win!

Smart Ass is an all play game. With every question asked, every player can yell out the answer at any time and as soon as they think they know the answer.

There are four question categories: Who am I? Where am I? What am I? and Hard Ass! The 500 questions are formulated into lots of clues. The clues get easy as the question is being read out, but don't wait too long to answer, as the first person to yell out the right answer, wins the round and moves closer to the Smart Ass. If you yell out the wrong answer, then you are out of that round and have to wait 'till the next question is asked.

Beware of the "Dumb Ass" and "Kick Ass" squares, as penalty awaits!

The first person to land on the donkey's butt is declared the "Smart Ass".

Smart Ass was created by Rob Elliott, the long time host of Australian Channel Seven's "Wheel of Fortune". So come and enjoy the real Aussie flavor of this inclusive and fun, but still competitive game
27389.name: Smart Ass
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 58!!!

27390.name: The Fess Parker Trail Blazers Game
27390.description: Game based on the TV show "The Daniel Boone Show" starring Fess Parker. Roll and Move game.

27391.name: Drinko
27391.description: Drink up! This classic drinking game is made for over-21 fun! Featuring a Plinko-like game board with six round discs and six matching shot glasses.

27392.name: Weinlese auf Hierro
27392.description:
All players plan their actions simultaneously in their mind. The goal is to move the meeple over the board after 60 seconds of thinking time has gone by. First the player with the highest down-written number has to show his solution. If he can solve he gets as many points as he wrote down. Each player has to show his solution to get the points. If the solution is false, he will get the points of the worst solution.

The points will be added and after 6 rounds there will be a winner.

27393.name: Voyager Space Card Game
27393.description:
’Voyager’ is an educational card game involving scientific satellites developed for use in schools with children aged 9 to 13 years. The idea of the game is to improve pupils’ knowledge about the large number of scientific satellites there are in space in a fun way, while also practicing number skills.

This game was available through the loopgames.co.uk website, but is currently out of print.

27394.name: Osakepeli
27394.description: A game about the stock market. Players buy stocks and pay customer fees. A player wins, if the other players go bankrupt. If that is not happening, the players can choose the ending time together. The stocks are sold with the prices of a randomly chosen card. The wealthiest wins.

27395.name: Taatuu-taatuu
27395.description: Children's game where players are firemen. Players roll the die and move their fireman, putting on pieces of equipment or taking them off as dictated by the space. When you land on a fire space, an inertia fire engine is pushed, and it speeds around the board: if it stops next to you, the fireman gets to put on two items. First dressed wins. No thought required. The pieces are pretty decent to look at.

27396.name: Le jeu des 7 dictionnaires
27396.description:
French game based on a show of the RTBF (Radio Télévison Belge).

The player rolls a dice and advances, depending on the type of square he lands on, he might have to guess a definition, guess the author of a quote or even find the words that fit an appropriate combination of another word and its adjectives.

Some areas are specially indicated "dictionnaire" (which means dictionary) and on these areas the questions are related to different categories ( exotic word, lost word, regional word, literature, culinary word, French slang (argot) or words from the francophone world (ex: Quebec, l'Île Maurice, etc.). Each category has a color and a small wooden dictionary.

When a player has a correct answer on one of these areas, he wins the appropriate dictionary. To win the game, the player needs to get a preset number of dictionaries (determined at the beginning of the game by the players).

27397.name: Head1liners
27397.description:
This game contains 386 pictures. The goal is to create the "best" headline for each picture. All the players vote and the player receiving the most votes gets to move up.
each player plays every time to create the funniest, most interesting or zaniest headline for the image.
The winner is the person that gets to the finish line by receiving the most votes for their head1lines.
If a player gets too far ahead they play with a handicap to keep the game competitive for players of all ranges.
This is a green game made from recycled materials.

27398.name: Conquest of Oz
27398.description:
Conquest of Oz is a free game by Warp Spawn Games and is the first in Lloyd's Oz Trilogy series. Card game for 2 players.
Based on the Imaginary world of Oz. One player represents the forces of good. The other player is the forces of evil. The Good & Evil Characters each have their own unique Decks. The deck contains one of each card in the card list.
Card Types include: Characters, Companions, Locations, Items,
Modifiers, Powers, Attacks, Events

27399.name: Armies of Oz
27399.description: Armies of Oz is a free game by Warp Spawn Games and is the second in Lloyd's Oz Trilogy series. A full on battle for Oz! Large scale warfare in the Land of Oz. The map depicts an irregular, interlocked set of territories. Each Territory compromises a small section of Oz. Players will have to create their own Game Map. The picture above shows a map of Oz taken from the original books.

27400.name: Oz Quest
27400.description: Oz Quest is a free game by Warp Spawn Games and is the third in Lloyd's Oz Trilogy series. Based on the WarpQuest game system. Each player takes the role of a child visitor to the Wondrous World of Oz.

27401.name: Television Empire
27401.description:
The aim of Television Empire is to build your own Television Network, buying resources and earning ratings, until your network has achieved supremacy.

From the publisher's website:

Choose the Shows... Build a Network...
Create the ULTIMATE Television Empire.

So you don't like what's on TV these days?
Think you could do a better job?

Well here's the chance to do it your way...

Television Empire is an exciting game of strategy and skill for 2-6 players. Compete to secure hit shows, hire trustworthy anchors and build network ratings.

27402.name: Golems
27402.description: Fantasy Wargame for 2-4+ players. You are a mighty Wizard. Use your Magic to make Golems to defeat you enemies. Use tiles to make the board. Units are created with a combination of size, shape, and material cards. Lots of Flavor and special fiddly rules. A fair amount of record keeping because each unit is unique. Free copy of the rules available at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Golem.html

27403.name: La Gerusalemme Liberata
27403.description:
"La Gerusalemme Liberata" is a simple boardgame with paper miniatures that represent the two factions involved: Tho Holy Crusade and the Arab.

The map board is the City of Jerusalem with strong wall perimeter.

Mechanics are similar to a chess game, where miniatures "eat" other miniatures according to rules which are used to determine which is stronger.

The game is for children, because the game has elemental strategy and a few simple rules.

27404.name: Look Out Below
27404.description:
From the box:

'RAISE THE FIREMAN AS HIGH AS HE WILL GO
IN THE BALANCING GAME CALLED ...
LOOK OUT BELOW'

'Raise the fireman on his ladders - higher and higher and higher! Then, try to lower him down to earn points. But, if the ladders start swaying and the fireman falls ... you better LOOK OUT BELOW!'

Box measures 13" x 17" x 4".

The game consists of a molded plastic, bucket-carrying fireman about 8" high who stands on a platform which accepts plastic ladders that are inserted from below. There are six colorful 8" long ladders, restricting the how far the fireman can be raised. A large circular plastic fire net 12" in diameter is used to catch the falling fireman. A colorful spinner directs gameplay.

Points are scored for raising and lowering the fireman (i.e. adding & then removing ladders) without causing him to fall (10 points per ladder). The fireman must be balanced by holding the bottom ladder ONLY. Points are also scored if the player holding the net catches the falling fireman (50 points).

The first player to reach 150 points is the winner.

27405.name: Firehouse Mouse
27405.description:
From the box:

'IT'S A 5 ALARM FUN FILLED RIOT!

Lickety-split! Quick! Quick!
Before the mouse comes down the stick!'

'IDEA OF THE GAME - The object is to get 4 of the same cards before the mouse slides down the pole. This is done by drawing & passing cards just as fast as you can. Watch the mouse and try to guess which number he will point to when he lands because cards of that number become "wild".'

Box measures 12" x 22" x 2".

The 22" high firehouse backdrop (thick die cut card with period illustrations) is supported by a plastic base (which also serves as the spinner) and a red plastic roof; a metal rod connects the plastic roof to the center of the spinner. A plastic mouse attached to a small doughnut shaped piece of plastic is slid onto the top of the metal rod and positioned to commence each round.

The spinner is used to designate 'wild' cards and to keep track of scores and round number. Players are dealt 5 cards; these are made of thick cardstock and are numbered 1-12, with 4 of each number. The mouse is nudged and set on its way. Players attempt to get as many of the same cards as they can by drawing & passing before the mouse reaches the spinner base. Only 5 cards may be held at any time.

When the mouse reaches the spinner below, cards are compared. The segment which is occupied by the nose of the mouse becomes 'wild', so players can use cards of this number to enhance their hand. The winner of the hand is the player with the highest number of identical cards, or the holder of the best cards if 2 or more players have an identical number of similar cards.

After 12 rounds of play, the WINNER is the player who has won the most hands.

27406.name: The Spider's Web
27406.description:
The Spider's Web is a game that helps children develop strategic thinking in an entertaining team environment.

Every roll of the dice gives players an opportunity to make a simple choice about the direction they want to move. The game pits a Spider player against one to four Firefly players who must escape from the web before the spider captures them.

Starting in the center of a spider's web, the Fireflies have to land on twigs in order to work their way off the web, but they need to stay clear of the Spider, who tries to land on them to send them back to their starting point.

When any one Firefly is able to escape from the web, all the Fireflies win. However, if the Spider can catch the Fireflies four times before any of them escape, the Spider wins.

Awards:
* Creative Child Magazine´s 2006 GAME OF THE YEAR
* Dr. Toy´s 2006 Smart Toy/Smart Play Award
* 2006 iParenting Media HOT AWARD
* The National Parenting Center´s 2006 Seal of Approval

27407.description:
This obscure Korean game is published by Jolly Game. Notice that Jolly Game is not related to Jolly Games of Wiz-war, at all.

The game is one of multiple series of games that was sold for 1,000 KRW, which is about one USD.

The game contained a few plastic SD Gundam figures, with very simplified typical war game rules.
27407.name: Super Deformed Gundam World

27408.description:
The Dragonball Ball Z CCG was created by Score and had a good number of expansions or sets before finally dying.

All players start the game with a character from the series, called the main personality. Each main personality character usually has three levels, to a maximum of five. Throughout the game, the main personality can get stronger via gaining anger, replacing the previous version played.

Decks are divided into seven different styles: Blue, Red, Orange, Black, Saiyan, Namekian and Free-Style. Each style focuses on a different aspect of combat. For instance, the Red style focuses on gaining anger, while the Namekian style focuses on life and energy. If a player uses nothing but one color or style in his or her deck, the player would be able to declare a Tokui-waza at the start of the game, allowing various benefits, such as certain cards allowing additional powers, as stated in the card's text box.

Later expansions allowed you to play Mastery cards that allowed abilities that always stayed in play. Sensei cards were also eventually introduced, allowing for sideboards to cater against one's opponent.

There are three ways to win the game. First is to reduce your opponent's deck to zero cards. Second is to win via having the most powerful personality, via gaining anger. This win condition may sometimes be not available, depending on who one's main personality is. Third is to play or capture, all seven Dragon Balls. Again, this win condition may sometimes be unavailable, depending on how decks are constructed.

The bulk of the Dragon Ball Z CCG focuses on combat. Players alternate as attacker and defender. Attacks are divided into physical and energy attacks. Physical attacks reduce the opponent's power levels, eventually dealing life damage. Energy attacks deal damage directly, but usually costs two power levels to perform. Players must strike a balance between offense and defense, as cards are discarded from one's deck upon taking damage, making it possible for a certain card to be discarded from play, even before being used.

The game was criticized to be highly random and greatly dependent on having better cards than one's opponent, as opposed to simply being the better player. Nonetheless, the tournament scene was quite popular during the game's existence, and the secondary market remains strong even after the game has died out.
27408.name: Dragon Ball Z CCG

27409.name: Dragon Ball GT TCG
27409.description: Use Dragonball GT Warriors and try to defeat your opponent! Can either be played as a stand alone game, or with the cards from the Dragon Ball Z CCG in Extended Format.

27411.name: Dragon Ball Z TCG
27411.description: Use your favorite Dragonball Z Warriors and try to defeat your opponent! This game CANNOT be used with the Dragonball Z CCG or the Dragonball GT TCG

27412.name: Csillagok Háborúja
27412.description:
An old (1986) Hungarian game based on the Star Wars: New Hope film.

It is like other Escape from Death Star games but with different rules and board.

The Rebels have to escape from the Death Star by rescuing princess Leia and blowing up the tractor beam generator. Obi-Wan Kenobi has to fight Darth Vader.

The Imperials have to hinder the Rebels and have to blow up the Millenium Falcon.

The Rebel side: Chewbacca, Han Solo, R2D2, C-3PO, Luke, Leia, Obi-Wan and some rebel fighters with blasters.

The Imperial side: Darth Vader and numerous storm troopers

Disable the tractor beam, fight the storm troopers, prison block escape, stop the garbage compactor in time, fight Darth Vader...

Part of the Star Wars games family of games

27413.name: Stumpz
27413.description:
Stumpz is a cricket game from the famous Thomas De La Rue & Co. Ltd, makers of playing cards and printers of English Bank notes.

Stumpz is described as "The Indoor Cricket Game Played by The Australian Test Team, English Teams and Keen Cricketers Everywhere".

It contains many elements of cricket missing from many cricket board games, including being able to determine line and length, field settings and so on. The game is a small work of art and came in deluxe and budget versions (as far as I can tell). While the budget version has player pieces represented by small wooden tokens and a material play mat, the deluxe version has small, lead figures of cricketers in various poses, and a mounted board.

All in all a lovely little game in the small field of cricket board games.

Note: This game was published circa 1931 for the first time and was designed by Charles Goodall, the great grandson of the founder of playing card company, Goodall & Sons. The game was published by De La Rue following its purchase in 1922 of Goodall & Sons.

27414.description:
Players try to find the right ingredients that are specified on a given cocktail card by simultaneously collecting tokens.
All players act in real-time in this game. The tokens for ingredients must be collected in a specific sequence.
The player that can finish a cocktail card first collects the card for points.
27414.name: Think: Cocktail

27415.description: This is a variant of the classic "Ludo"/"Mensch ärgere dich nicht". You roll around the board, kicking back opponent pieces. The own playing pieces can be upgraded with the roll of a "1", which enables it to be protected against lower pieces.
27415.name: Zoff der Zünfte

27416.description:
This new game by Reiner Knizia is a game for children to learn easy calculations with numbers from 0 up to 100.

There are two different games included in the package, one is called "Flußurlaub", the other "Besuch von Neptun".

The first game is a kind of area-control, where players win an area by placing 2 tokens of their color in the area. The areas contain numbers that represent results of calculations that a player has to do right.

The next game is a racing game, where a die decides the place where the Neptune-figure has to be moved to. Players try to reach Neptune first by putting tokens on an area with numbers. The numbers are again results of calculations that a player has to do right.
27416.name: Abenteuer auf dem Zahlen-Fluss

27417.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple abstract game about the Cold War struggle for influence in Latin America. The winner is the first player to control five Central American countries, using methods such as monetary aid, agents, Marxist revolutionaries, or military presence.
27417.name: Latin Intervention

27418.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple game of Kublai Khan's 1271 invasion of Japan. One player controls the forces of Kublai Khan while the other controls the Japanese forces. Khan needs to move his fleets from Korea to Japan, avoiding a moving hurricane, to defeat the outnumbered samurai units. The game uses a compact area movement map.
27418.name: KHAN!

27419.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"As the Turkish union moves through the stars, a combined group of Euro-Union, and Japanese fleets move to protect their assets. Recently though the Turkish fleets have been growing ever so stronger with their eventual rise as a major space power. Right now they are attempting to land grab and then settle for peace!"

A simple game of spaceship fleet combat from the One Page Wars game series. Up to three players take on the GM controlled Ottoman forces.
27419.name: Upon the Stars Backs

27420.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple solo (or two player) game of annihilating Napoleon's march from Russia. Cossack units are rated for speed and anger/patriotism, while the French units are rated for speed, military gain, and treasure gain. The cossacks (played by the solo player) tries to eliminate as many military gain points as possible before all of the French units have moved off the area map.
27420.name: Devil Horsemen

27421.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"A crack to Hadell has just opened. Now skeletons and demons are pouring out of it! As the only three true heroes around, it is your job to hold the fort until backup arrives." A One Page Wars series game.

A barbarian, cleric, and archer fight a growing pack of skeletons in a narrow church. Each unit and monster is rated for power, movement, attack range, and hit points.
27421.name: That Little Crack?

27422.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

Players compete in an Olympic biathlon event. Competitors from the US, France, Russia, Canada, and Italy seek to ski through the course with the fastest time while shooting accurately at three groups of targets. Each skier is rated for shooting accuracy and physical ability.
27422.name: Biathlon

27423.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple game of ship to ship combat in 1453 from the One Page Wars series. Four Byzantine galleys try to break through a large contingent of Ottoman vessels and get to the Golden Horn. The mapsheet uses irregular shaped areas and the game abstractly covers boarding and ranged combat.
27423.name: By the Walls of Constantinople

27424.name: Skiers
27424.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

The players attempt to get down the ski slope in the fastest time possible. The slope is a string of connected spaces, each of which is rated for difficulty. You must choose between "normal" and "risky" movement. A die roll determines the success of each move. Ski for the US, Russia, Canada, France, or Italy.

27425.name: Battles: Win or Lose
27425.description: Battles: Win or Lose is a two-player game that challenges players to use instinct and intuition to defeat their opponent. Don the powers and strengths of 20 different characters and pit them against each other in an all-out slugfest of the fittest. Be the cunning Rogue, or the powerful Fire Mage. Swap blows with the Barbarian while your Thug hides, waiting for the opportunity to strike with deadly precision. Empower your party with the holy blessings of the Paladin or send your Opponent to the grave with the Necromancer. The way you play is up to you.

27426.name: Fairy Meat: WAR
27426.description:
From the Publisher's website:

In War, Straightedge Fairies, Greater Fae, Goblikes and Imps enter the scene! With amber armor, sunflower bombs, pistols, rifles and other dangerous weapons, the Straightedges bring squad-based war to the fairies! Goblike mercenaries strengthen this army (when they're not busy eating it), and Imps and Greater Fae likewise enjoy the new state of fairy affairs. After all, in the old days, it was frowned upon to senselessly riddle another fairy with a hail of arrows!

Even better, this 32-page Fairy Meat supplement features new rules for establishing ongoing campaigns! With skill points, your fairies can learn as they kill and become tougher than ever! This book also includes rules for Fame, new printable warband and squad sheets, and much more! Although War is fully compatible with Fairy Meat, it is a supplemental rulebook only. Unless you already know how to play, you will need the Fairy Meat core rulebook in order to play effectively.

Expands:

Fairy Meat

27427.name: Hölle auf Erden
27427.description:
From the Publisher's website:

Hölle auf Erden (Hell on Earth)

A Zombie Supplement for NUTS!

World War Two... The “Big One”, what’s not to like? Big tanks, rat-a-tat-tat machine guns, pin up art on airplanes. Oh yeah, what’s better than that?

Zombies! You know, the walking dead, “brains”, scary things that go bump in the dark. What is it about Zombies? Yeah, what’s better than that?

How about a WW2 game with Zombies? Now you’re talking! Welcome to HÖLLE AUF ERDEN or HOE.

What you have here is the blending of “NUTS!” the man-to-man skirmish game from Two Hour Wargames and “All Things Zombie”, the game of surviving during a zombie breakout. It’s about Allied forces in WW2 running into hordes of the undead as a result of Hitler’s last big gamble to win the war.
If you’re looking for something a little bit different you’ve come to the right place. Go grab some figures and let’s get it started!

We've designed HOE to be played with any figures you already have and in any scale. So pull out those favorite figures, slip in your favorite Zombie movie, and remember... JUST PLAY THE GAME!

HOE is a supplement to “NUTS!” and not a stand-alone game. So you’ll need to have a copy of ”NUTS!” to play HOE.

27428.name: Tall Bird, Short Bird
27428.description:
In this children's game, players compete to create either the tallest or shortest birds, adding cards that show either a bird's head or its feet to the bird bodies on the gameboard.

To start, each player receives three cards. Each player chooses one card and places it face down in front of him. The first player calls out either "Tall bird!" or "Short bird!" That sets the criterion for the round. Each player then places the card he chose on the board, and the players determine who has the tallest or shortest bird, depending on which was called. The winning player gets an "egg," one of the cardboard counters used to keep score. Each player then draws a new card.

Play proceeds in the same way to the next player to the left, and cards are played on top of each player's existing cards on the board.

The game ends when the last card is drawn. The player with the most eggs wins.

This game is marked as "Piatnik Item No. 328," and probably was originally published in German in Austria. This summary is based on an English version printed in Austria but distributed by Discovery Toys of Martinez, Calif.

27429.description:
Operation Weserübung: The Invasion of Norway covers the German invasion of Norway in 1940 during World War II. The game covers all aspects of the invasion, including land, naval, and air operations as well as the British and French involvement.

Operation Weserübung is a two-player or three-player game, with one player taking the Germans and the other player or players taking Norway and Great Britain/France. The game is regimental scale with each hex representing approximately 20-25 kilometers with turns representing four days. The combat system is roll-to-hit and the entire game system is based on the system from World War II in the West. This game is also a preview of what the system for World War II in the West: Ultimate Edition will look like when it is published in late 2007. Turn phases include the Air Phase, the Naval Phase, the Combat Phase, the Movement Phase, and the End Phase. The game includes everything from air interception to naval-air combat, from parachute drops to amphibious assaults. While the game strives to be an accurate simulation, the level of enjoyment and ease of play is also a priority.

The game is a medium to low complexity and should be easy to learn relatively quickly. The game can take approximately 5-8 hours to complete.

Operation Weserübung contains approximately 225 mounted counters in easy-to-cut strips. All historical land and naval units are represented in the game and individually identified. Divisional leaders are also included as well as an Admiral. All ships larger than a destroyer are individually identified and included, and air units are divided into counters representing a few squadrons of each type of aircraft. The Germans can call on the Messerschmitt Bf109 E, Messerschmitt Bf110 C, Junkers 87, Heinkel 111, and Junkers 52 during the game, while the Allies have a few Gloster Gladiators, Fairey Swordfish, Vickers Wellingtons, Capronis, and Hawker Hurricanes to try to stop the invasion. All air units have images of the aircraft on the counter while naval units have the historical profiles of the ship represented.

Counters are all two step and as shown in these pictures, have values on the top and bottom edge of the counter. Thus, the facing of the counter is important. This is similar to the system used in Distant Foreign Fields but a departure from the Second Edition of World War II in the West. Look for this feature in the Ultimate Edition of this latter game

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 4 days
Hex: 12-15 miles / 20-25 kilometers
Units: Regiments

Game Inventory:
Three 12 x 18" full color mapsheets
Ten single-side printed non-diecut counterstrips (240 5/8" counters)
One 24-page Operation Weserubung spiral-bound rulebook
One Player Aid card
Two 10-sided dice

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2-3 or more
Playing Time: 5-8
27429.name: Operation Weserübung: The Invasion of Norway

27430.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple, generic Napoleonic battle game in which the British and French battle over cities at opposite corners of the mapsheet. Each side has infantry, cavalry, and artillery units, with each player being allowed to select the composition of their forces using a point system.
27430.name: Napoleonic Battles

27431.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

In this simple World War II game, the Germans battle the US and British across an area map of France. Units are rated for attack, defense, and movement. There are two scenarios.
27431.name: WW2 France

27432.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple abstract game of modern air combat between India and Pakistan played out on a small area map. The object is to destroy all of the opposing aircraft. Aircraft are rated for attack and defense, and combat is resolved by die roll when opposing aircraft occupy the same area on the mapsheet.
27432.name: Over Pakistan

27434.name: Animal Kingdom
27434.description:
A family card game for four or five players.

Players battle to build competing ecosystems between different animals.

Featuring 80 cards, each with a unique illustration, and four short pages of rules.

27435.name: Dial Away
27435.description:
This game was made for British Telecom.

Players must complete a given phone number , with the country, area code and the cost of the call.
To do that, players spin a dial and collect the needed numbers available on the section where the dial points at.

If players don't get the correct combination of numbers they must pay a forfeit consisting of talking about a certain topic for a minute.

27436.name: Que Pasa
27436.description:
A proprietary card game based on the standard social card game known in books as "I Doubt It," but more popularly as "Bulls**t." It was created by a college business professor in Alva, Okla., in the early 1990s and marketed by his startup company.

The deck consists of 72 cards in 14 denominations. Each denomination, numbered 1 to 14, depicts a leisure activity, such as "Golfing" or "Shopping." As in "I Doubt It," the object is to shed all your cards. Players announce in turn that they are discarding a certain number of cards in a certain denomination, always having the option to bluff. The other players can challenge. Anyone losing a challenge must take all the discards.

Unlike "I Doubt It," the game requires players in turn to play cards in the same denomination rather than increasing denominations. (In other words, if Player 1 plays "Hunting" cards and goes unchallenged, the Player 2 must either play "Hunting" cards or pass.) The denomination changes after a challenge -- or if all players pass, at which point the discard pile is retired and started anew. The game also includes a denomination of wild cards (1, "Anything Goes"), and one denomination (13, "Fooling Around") that can only be played as part of a bluff.

Once a player sheds all his cards, he scores the point total of all cards remaining in his opponents' hands. The game ends at 100 points. The game also offers rules for couples to play in partnerships.

27437.name: Three Dimensional Dominoes
27437.description:
From The Box...

Three Dimensional Dominoes

> 45 triangular dominoes, each with sectional numbers to be matched up as in conventional dominoes, but wait till you see the challenging differences.

> Six exciting "3-D" domino charts included.

>One Interesting "Solitaire" domino game chart included

Note: "3-D" dominoes was created and designed by mathematical experts following a specific formula. You will find the games most effective and more challenging when played on the design charts inside, whether for multiple or solitaire play.

> Full simple directions and charts inside box.

27438.description:
The sounds of horns and the cries of men as they rush to battle, these sounds of war have been heard about the mighty Realms for ages. Now the battle of the many races has exploded into total war, a war to see who will rule the many lands of mighty Realms.

Realms, Total War, is the newest expansion for the Realms system. Now you can expand your Realms struggles with more tactical considerations, more magic, more troops and more fun. So gather a gang of friends together and have a few hours of glorious war, excitement and gaming fun.

Note that Realms, Total War, is not a complete game, and requires that you have one or more copies of the Realms games.

This game requires Realms: Elves & Orcs to play.
27438.name: Realms: Total War

27440.description:
From the box:
"Will you be the first Cinderella to go to the ball? Collect 5 different cards and the Fairy Godmother will help you transform your cards to get ready for the ball. If you collect the invitation, the coach, the horses, the footman & the coachman as well as your ball gown, you will be the Cinderella who goes to the ball!"

Players move Cinderella pieces around a board, in the center of which is a glass slipper on a cushion. Land on the fairy godmother squares, press the slipper and it may transform the humble cards you have collected (mice, pumpkin etc.) into the things you need for the ball.
27440.name: Cinderella Glass Slipper Game

27441.name: Casino
27441.description:
Casino, "The Incredible All-In-One Game", was published in the Philippines in 1981. The components is composed of a gameboard, various cards, play money, tokens, dice, and a rule sheet.

The gameboard has tracks around it wherein the tokens can traverse upon the roll of the dice just like in Monopoly. But there are subtle differences: instead of streets the tracks are mostly illustrations of different Casino-related games. When a player lands on a track with a specified game, he must play that game by placing a bet using play money and drawing the related card. The card drawn will show the "summarized" result whether the player wins money or loses them. There are also other types of tracks wherein any player who lands on them automatically loses money or gains some.

The object of the game is to win the largest amount of play money and avoid becoming bankrupt.

27442.name: Die drei ???: Geheimsache Ufo
27442.description:
Deduction card game based on the Three Investigators stories. The 3 ??? are Jupiter, Bob and Pete (in the German version - Justus, Bob and Peter). There are 3 types of suspect cards, place cards and mystery cards and 3 cards which show all 9, plus 3 detective cards (Justus, Bob and Peter), 4 player pieces and the gameboard.

Guess the gameplay could be described as Cluedo meets Go Fish!

27443.description:
There are three accepted variants of Baccarat; Baccarat Chemin de Fer, Baccarat Banque and Punto Banco. Typically played in Casinos, several standard decks of 52 cards are shuffled together and dealt from a communal card shoe.

All three variants operate on the same principle; 2 cards are dealt in alternating order to a hand designated as the Player, and a hand designated as the Banker. Typically the Player hand is played by the person who bet the most on the Player's hand to win. Depending on the variant being played, certain circumstances allow either participant to draw an extra card then the cards are totaled (2s through 9s are worth their face value while 10s and face cards are worth ten points and aces are worth one point). If the total of a hand's cards exceed 10 points, the tens digit is dropped. The hand with a total closest to 9 wins and neither hand wins in the event of a tie.

Punto Banco is the most common variant in North America, but requires no skill and operates solely on chance. Typically played in Casinos, the house always plays the Banker hand (although players may still bet on that hand to win). It is usually played with eight (8) decks of cards shuffled together.

Conversely, Baccarat Banque and Baccarat Chemin de Fer (more common in Europe) allow the players to make choices during the game so a player's skill can affect the outcome. In either of these variants a player may choose to play the Banker himself and the other players play against his 'Bank' (supply of money). In Baccarat Chemin de Fer, the Bank passes when the Banker looses a hand. In Baccarat Banque, a player may remain the Banker so long as he still has funds or until all cards in the shoe have been dealt. Baccarat Banque is typically played with 3 decks of cards while Baccarat Chemin de Fer is typically played with 6. In most cases these variants are played completely in French even in English-speaking areas.

Since the Banker has a slight edge over the Player in his chances of winning a hand, the house taxes all winning Banker bets when played in a casino (typically 5%).
27443.name: Baccarat

27444.name: Wordlink
27444.description: This Scrabble-like game is made in India and is for 2 to 4 players, with a solo game option. Like Scrabble, players draw 7 tiles from a pool of 100 (including two blanks) and try to form words, crossword fashion, on a 16 by 16 square grid. The board includes bonus squares that double, triple or quadruple the word score. There are also squares that allow the player an extra turn. Scores are based on the number of letters in the word - the letters do not have differing point values: they are all worth one point each, except for blanks, which are worth nothing but can be used to represent any letter.

27445.name: Balance Cup Game
boardgamepublisher: Wing Tat Hang Kee Co. Ltd.
27445.description:
The Balance Cup Game (Wing Tat Hang Kee Co. Ltd.) is a simple dexterity game using plastic cups shaped like martini glasses. 20 plastic cups in four colors (including one white cup) are arranged in a pyramid with the white cup at the top. Players roll a special six-sided die that has three sides showing a black cup, and the other three sides showing a dot that is either red, green or yellow. If it shows a colored dot, the player has to remove a cup of the corresponding color. If it shows a black cup, the player can remove a cup of any color. The player who causes the white cup to fall loses, and has to rebuild the pyramid for the next game.

The Glass Tower Game (Daiso) is a similar game with the same sort of components but the opposite objective - players roll the die and then stack cups according to the die roll. On a roll of 1 to 4, the player has to stack a cup of the corresponding colour - no action if there are no more cups of that colour. On a roll of 5, the player can stack a cup of any colour, and on a six, the player does not need to stack any cup). The player who puts the last cup on top of the stack wins. Four different structures can be made with the cups, to play the game.

27446.name: Het Pinkeltje Spel
27446.description:
Who is the first to reach Pinkelotje?

Try to reach the forest at the other side and return home to Pinkelotje. Each player gets one pawn. You move your pawn by taking a "can I" card, then ask the player left of you if you may use the given card. He or she answers by saying "yes, you can" or "no, you can't". If you are not allowed to use the card, then take a "you cannot" card, and follow the directions on it. The board has some obstacles you must avoid. When you reached the forest, take your Pinkelotje picture and return home.

This game is based on the popular dutch character Pinkeltje from writer Dick Laan.

27447.name: Azteken Schatz
27447.description:
Every player starts with 100 points. If any get to 200 he/she wins. Every round starts with point bidding to get the start player token. The start player can break ties and choose tasks the player bidding at.
The tasks are like "get the most tricks" or "get the most coins". There are two tasks per player and four cards which you´ll get with the task cards.
There are three types of cards : coins, charms and mojos. Every round one player plays a card and the other players must to play a higher card with the same symbol. The player with the highest card of the played symbol get all played cards and wins the trick.

Components
-72 cards
- 5 info cards
- 1 start player token
- 50 1-point coins
- 10 50-point coins
- 1 rule sheet

27448.name: AcaMania
27448.description:
AcaMania was designed by three national champion Academic Decathletes, with artwork by Tipatat Chennavasin. Players must race from the "pit" to the national competition, contending with four kinds of curriculum-related challenges--both creative and academic--along the way.

To make it around the board to the National Competition, teams of Decathletes must master five categories of game cards, ranging from the creative to the intellectual to the simply outrageous. Depending on what cards they draw, players could be required to change events from the curriculum, mimic philosophical figures, hum the music pieces, sketch artworks, answer true/false questions, unscramble important phrases and much, much more.

27449.name: Syzigy
27449.description:
This chess-like game is played on a round board consisting of 157 circular spaces, connecting both circularly (around the board) and radially (from the outside to the center). The outer rings connect all the way around circularly, but the inner rings have gaps, requiring more complex routes to navigate.
Each player has 7 Sages, 4 Stouts, and 4 Royals (one of which is the Czar). The Sages move 5 circles, and may only capture Royals/Czars. The Stouts move 4, and may only capture Sages, and the Royals/Czars move only 3, but may capture Stouts and Sages.
Capturing requires landing on an appropriate opponent piece. To win, you must capture your opponent's Czar, or all of either his Sages or Stouts.

27450.name: Fish Antics
27450.description: Fish Antics is a Go Fish variant in which cards specify how many matches you need to play it. Cards have special abilities that activate once played.

27451.description: New edition of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. This edition comes with 2500 new ideas. The board has been redesigned and the rules slightly changed. Now you can choose from three different card stacks which allow you to move 3, 4 or 5. Your opponent has to go back one space when you reach the same field.
27451.name: Activity 2

27453.name: Zenergy
27453.description:
More than a boardgame, more than a word game or puzzle, Zenergy is a unique creative sculpture game.

Using the provided wooden blocks, you are asked to symbolize in sculpture ideas ranging from everyday events and objects to abstract concepts.

Challenging yet entertaining, thought provoking and often hilarious, Zenergy is a deceptively simple game and one that will provide hours of fascination.

Rebuild your imagination - play Zenergy.

For teams of 2 or more players, aged 15 to adult.

Contents:
54 wooden blocks
250 cards
1 board
2 dice
counters

27454.name: The Game of Captain Kangaroo
27454.description:
This game for children Ages 4 10 gets it title from an Educational Children's Television Program geared to pre-schoolers (1955-1980).

Captain Kangaroo (Bob Keeshan) and Mr. Green Jeans (Hugh Brannum) starred .

This is s simple match the colors in order to move kind of game.

27455.name: Family Affair
27455.description: The Family Affair Game is based on a television show of the same name that was on the air in the late 1960's. The show starred Brian Keith as Uncle Bill Davis, Sebastion Cabot as the butler Mr. French, and the three orphaned kids, Cissy (Kathy Garver), Jody (Johnnie Whitaker) and Buffy (Anissa Jones - she died a couple of years after the show went off the air of a drug over-dose). This was a dice rolling game and had 4 cardboard cutout pieces each in 4 different colors. What you rolled with the dice determined which area you looked at to determine what happened to you.

27456.name: Route 66
27456.description: This game based on the Television series of the same name featuring George Maharis as Buzz Murdoch and Martin Milner as Todd Stiles came with a simple board, 8 plastic playing pieces, 4 plastic cars, play money, a double spinner and road map instructions. The map had famous towns listed on it and the road map which was located inside the box had special instructions for the player who landed on particular spaces. The object was to get your car located on the gameboard to complete the trip across the country.

27457.name: Riachuelo's Naval Battle
27457.description:
The Riachuelo’s Naval Battle is a war game for two players, that reproduces the riverine naval battle of June 11, 1865, where, during the War of the Triple Alliance (known in Brazil as the Paraguayan War). In this battle the admiral Barroso achieved an important victory, destroying a great part of the Paraguayan fleet.

The Naval battle of Riachuelo, was on the Paraná river, in the province of Corrientes, Argentina and is considered by the military historians as one of the most important battles of Triple Alliance War (1864-1865). It is also known as one of the main naval battles of the Brazilian Navy and it guaranteed the supremacy of Brazil in terms of naval control.

The game comes with the following components:
11"x17" Color Map
Rules Booklet with Designer and Historical notes
Player aids
Ship cards
45 counters

The game Riachuelo’s Naval Battle is the first game by Riachuelo Games to be released in English.

The Print-n-Play (PDF) version can be found at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=474

The Printed (DTP) version can be found at:
http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/

27458.name: Odisea Espacial
27458.description:
In "Space Odyssey", the players are technician-astronauts. Their mission is resolve all damages (of different sources) of a space station in a short space of time, because the auto-destruction is ON!!!

This Spanish game (around the middle of 80's) have plastic components of great quality. In this cooperative game each player select a character (pilot, mechanic, robot...) specializing in repair one class of damage. It's (probably) the first game in Spain with the mechanic of selection and specialization of characters.

En "Odisea Espacial" los jugadores son técnicos especialistas que han de reparar todas las averías (de diversos tipos) de una estación orbital en muy poco tiempo ya que... ¡¡La Auto-Destrucción se ha puesto en marcha!!.

Este es un juego español de mediados de los 80 con grandes componentes de plástico, y donde se experimentó (tal vez pioneramente) con los diversos papeles especialistas de los jugadores (piloto, mecánico, robot...) a la hora de resolver , cooperativamente, los diversos tipos de avería.

27459.name: Veja o Brasil
